3Jy-qOx33p6XM-rnfbVSCA.text: I'm torn.  Just left Akahana. We got carry out.  My daughter really enjoyed her lunch. And it was a decent portion size for the price. (She got the Chicken Lettuce Wrap for $6.)  My lunch was $4, for two spring rolls. Not bad but I can't be sure it was worth the price. The rolls were small and the garnish (curly thinly shredded carrots) and a few handfuls of the small white thin puffy noodles (?) were painfully meager.  I have pictures. Judge for yourself...  I'm sure my daughter will eat there again. Me? Maybe. Maybe not.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Untouched except to break open the spring roll.
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

KGtEE0e6AiGukxgImPY6Mg.text: i LOVE Akahana.  My boyfriend and I usually eat their once a week, and it is definitely our favorite restaurant.  Not only is the food fantastic, it's pretty cheap as well.  For dinner, we each usually get an appetizer and a roll and with tip it usually comes out under $30.  Nice!    I'd have to say that Felipe is my favorite waiter by far, he has made it a point to remember my boyfriend and I's names, and he's full of personality.  The other servers there are good too, but there have been a couple of occasions where certain ones try too hard to pressure you into drinks, apps, desserts, etc, and one of them always seems fake nice!  The hostess Camela is very sweet, and I look forward to seeing her when I come in.  The sushi is great, although sometimes my roll looks sloppier than other times (I usually get the same one because it's so good).  My boyfriend always enjoys his sushi.  I've also had the curry, and loved it!     If you haven't been to Akahana, you should go.  It's cheap (BOGO half off rolls!), the atmosphere is nice, and the food is good.

SZq7XyujTDsQLZABsuVqdg.text: There's nothing particularly wrong with Akahana. If you're looking for basic sushi/Asian cuisine then you'll be satisfied.  There's nothing spectacular about there establishment nor is there anything outlandishly enraging...except if your a group of 6 or more. Beware! Their practices are a bit sketchy. Parties of 6 or more are charged automatic gratuity (which is fine) however you're charged gratuity on your BOGO rolls. So don't think just because the roll was "free" that you won't still be paying for it.  So while the two top next to you gets the privilege of having BOGO rolls and tipping as they wish for mediocre service, parties 6 or more will be stuck paying 35% tip.  Seems like a rip off to me.

hakpfpcEWQokUWYiAR8nWQ.text: A consistently good place. I eat here at 2-3 times a month for several years now. Like most restaurants they may have an "off" night on occasion.  I'm a big fan of there sushi, pho and several Korean dishes.

e98QANn2mnusvtEtW9iLdQ.text: I was a regular lunch customer and service at first was amazing. Then there was a shift in management and the service level went to the dogs. The food is not as good as it was when the business first opened and now it is mediocre. The owner is not pleasant and needs a course is customer service. When a customer is not satisfied with the taste or if there is an ingredient in the meal that the customer can not have, you do not tell the customer that you will not take it off the bill!  I am glad I have a backbone and know how to address these issues.Customer Sevice 101 your customers are the reason you're in business.

BiFMsHpIx1FEXU0FwBnZUQ.text: I'll be generous and give Akahana 3 stars when it should probably be 2.5 stars. I was a frequent flyer of this place when it first opened, mostly because for a year this nice little bistro who offered buy one get one free sushi rolls. As someone who should probably open her own sushi restaurant to get a return on my investment, anytime I can save cash on sushi is a plus.  A while back the restaurant management changed and switched the deal to buy one get one half off. I understand this a business with profits to make so it didn't upset me but left my sushi-loving soul disappointed. Yet, I only dined here a good bit due to price and not quality... and even though the rolls the discounted, the prices are a bit higher so not truly snagging a discount. The sushi isn't bad by any means but not memorable - nothing that blows me away. At Ru Sans I covet the Firecracker roll. At Sushi 101, I always snag the Sir Justin roll. But I have yet to find an amazing roll at Akahana. Pretty average sushi here with no special sauces, ingredients or anything that makes me crave this eatery.  However, props to the bistro for the atmosphere. It's a sleek, modern design with plenty of room between the booths and tables so you're not invading anyone's personal space. Upon walking in, you're greeted with a waterfall trickling down a tall glass panel that almost hits the ceiling... nice touch. We've always been seated promptly at the restaurant and service is more times than not good. Never had bad service, just slow... and last time I never got my requested side of aioli... blasphemy.  Plus parking is easy and Akahana is located conveniently in Plaza Midwood... no fancy parallel parking here or trying to figure out how one-way streets connect.

JodS3roM5ZDpibL5IvspJQ.text: Previously, I felt that this restaurant was not one to "Yelp home about," but my last visit really stood out.  Akahana is located in a strip mall within walking distance of our home.  It features " buy one, get one half price" sushi rolls.  My husband and I have been here a few times and had an "ok" meal.  But this last time?  Holy blow fish!  Did that sushi chef just graduate to a black belt in rolls?  We ordered three vegetarian rolls that rivaled those at our favorite sushi restaurants.  Plus, service was sharp and snappy, to the point that the waiter nearly snatched away my last sip of wine as I lifted my glass.  Definitely warrants an encore and soon. But, I'm gluing my wine glass to my hand.

UqHIGaQIxAJLBR4dX4RO3g.text: Akahana is an OK place to go for an great variety of Asian style food. Their veggie sushi is ok and so is the miso soup, however their stir fry sauces are really unimpressive. Also the food seems to be pretty inconsistent in quality, ranging from 2 to 4 stars on any given visit.  While tucked away and not very noticeable on the outside, the inside is very nice. It's got a nice dark atmosphere, lots of dinning area, stylish decorations, and a pretty nice bar. The staff are all attentive and nice folk. It would be a good place for a date if the food was better and more consistent.

dW1AqU49-ASZ7RKDOtZ0PQ.text: My wife and I live in the area and eat here frequently. The service is always quick and the servers are genuinely interested in helping you enjoy the experience. In fact, the owner is almost always there going around and checking on things. Oh yes, and the sushi is fantastic and consistent. It's the perfect place for a casual night out, large groups, or a date.

1BiEymn9FimXqs8dBugIiQ.text: Well!! Little do I remember !  I wrote a review almost 3 years ago on this place... I remember NOT liking it there at akahana.  SOMEHOW  my friends encouraged me to try it one more time- FAIL.  The BOGO enticed me, let me tell ya, if those sushi rolls weren't bogo- I wouldve been soooo pissed off.  Its bogo for a reason folks.  The sushi is awful. Not much different from what I was claiming in 2012.  I tried the cherry blossom roll and the surf n turf. YUCK. My other 2 friends that were with me agreed that their rolls tasted old, just as mine did. My sushi had avocado where some of it was turning in color (old) and the salmon also did not look fresh....or the tuna.... DAMN!  Like seriously guys, sushi isnt your cup of tea.... practically 3 years later....STILL, simply put, AWFUL sushi.  I will never go back, I dont care what kind of luring special they advertise, on top of it all - believe it or not this place is pricey!  Like 14 bucks for something you wouldnt pay a dollar for.  Rusans, in my opinion,  can't be beat in Charlotte.

_duS1RK6AQeaS5nKUit-kA.text: Sushi rolls are buy one get on half off every night.   The quality is consistently good, and they have excellent miso soup.   The hot entrees look fantastic, but I have not tried any of them yet.   They frequently have drink specials, so we frequent this spot quite often as it's in our neighborhood.

EYCouCgoHdu3son1Z5ZAcg.text: Cool spot to have a meal and a drink.  Nice BOGO sushi menu with good rolls. Staff typically provides good service.

yQwRdwhUNf4AvmrRLuMMGg.text: Loved this place! Nice atmosphere, good service, and the sushi was delicious (I liked the Furious Dragon Roll). We got the spicy edamame as an appetizer and it was yummy - it wasn't overly spicy. Also - the sushi is BUY ONE ROLL GET ONE FREE!?? ALL THE TIME!??? I was surprised at how affordable it was considering the atmosphere. They have a lot of local beers on tap too - Birdsong, NoDa, etc. The parking lot is tough though - although it's across the street from some street parking & a Harris Teeter.

ncgMGrKl2eNl1QhrdVYrsQ.text: Good Sushi. Decent drinks. Polite staff. Reasonable price. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come back here but if I was in the area or someone else wanted to, I would eat here again.

EMIpDopgTGDdLBracuDw-g.text: I love this place!! Delicious food also at a fantastic price. You can't ask for much more than that. Service is always good too. You have to try the spicy edamame and the spicy spider roll!!! Can't go there without getting both. Highly recommend. Unless you're looking for fancy...which, I'm not.

30mIJlYiHzDEKhe_8Myhgg.text: Tables were sticky, sushi chef slow, waitress forgetful, food not so good and they overcharged us $10. Won't be back.

Mkytq9y4Lg8gZQAgXE3PWw.text: I've been here numerous times. The Charlotte Roll, Volcano Roll, Bagel Roll, and Spiral Extacy Roll are just some of my favorites. Their Pad Thai is amazing and my boyfriend always enjoys their Pho.   I usually get a draft PBR since they're only $1 but it's always ice cold. Some times they'll have $5 cocktails and I tried the Ginger Pear one and it was delightful.   We eat a lot and we're always surprised at how low our bill is when we leave so this is definitely one of our guilty pleasure spots with out feeling too guilty $$$.

LeBuU9XC9HIoV0ZBZz702g.text: I wish I could write a review on the food. However, the hostess was completely rude and didn't even seat me. She just motioned for me to go sit somewhere. It took waaay too long to get a menu considering I was the only person there. No one ever even came to get my drink order. The music selection was decent, but it's pathetic that I actually sat there and listened for so long without so much as a drink in front of me.

M8zTf0d9Cx49QsIAEF86jA.text: Unfortunately I decided to opt out of takeout and actually dine in for once. Big mistake. I always get to-go food here and it's consistently fair to middling. The same or less can be said for my food tonight, I had the lotus roll which has spicy tuna inside among other ingredients, but there was no spice at all. Pretty flavorless on the whole. But, the thing that really put me off of this place was the service. It was 845 pm, just got out of yoga and needed food and possibly a drink... Head to the bar where I'm greeted with a super unfriendly bartender who- right off the bat, instead of hello, I get a bristly l "do you need a drink menu?"... Maybe she had been having a bad day? She was somewhat helpful selecting the sake I ordered. She was on her phone/computer the whole time, didn't smile once and honestly made me slightly uncomfortable, I felt as if I was a burden. I definitely won't be back to dine in.

TiVWPSA2Z6w8kd1fqlNz2w.text: I live right down the street from this place, so I go a lot.  I have to admit that I don't like the music (think at a trendy nightclub) or the decor (the centerpiece is a sheet of glass with water running down it).  However.... everything, for me, revolves around the BOGO sushi rolls.  I can go into this place with a friend and we can both gorge ourselves on pretty good sushi for about 35$ total.  There are usually 1$ PBRs (I know, I know, a very classy way to wash down sushi), so I can have my full "dine and catch a light buzz" experience for about the same price.    I've never had a bad experience at this place, maybe some slow service but the rolls I order have always been on point and delicious.  The waitress I have the most often is also super nice, keeps my water topped and my beers coming.  Be warned though, it took me about three visits to figure out what is good and what just looks good on the menu.  Akahana is not world class-but it is a great deal with friendly servers.  Like any great deal you might have to do a little work on your end to make the experience match up to your expectations.  I highly recommend the place, as well as any of the flash fried rolls.  Mmmmmmmm Americanized sushi.  Yummmmm  There are also plenty of big TVs, so kick back and watch something while you stuff your face, I mean delicately pick up your sushi with your fancy chopsticks....

XY9BpumCPiqKd1o0lorgFQ.text: Great outdoor seating. A ton of creative sushi rolls to choose from, but also a good selection of Thai and other Asian inspired dishes. It's right next to a used book store and a Rita's with good parking, so it's a fun afternoon all in one place. The manager (or maybe owner?) was very friendly and his staff were accommodating to our odd requests. Chicken on the fried rice was pretty bland, but the rice itself was good. Maybe not the very best sushi I ever had, but still great and filling and BOGO all the time is hard to beat.

Lfy1NQNlBaARWT-JxIld6Q.text: I love me some Akahana. My girlfriend and I carry out at least weekly-- BOGO rolls 7 days/week!  Their bartenders are very knowledgeable when it comes to sake and let us sample anything we're considering.   The ideal meal looks like this: spicy edamame and hot sour soup to start; furious dragon roll and usually one of their seasonal/special rolls. When we're dining with friends and feeling festive we may get a paired beer/sake "bomb". The white zombie one is a crowd pleaser.   I'm always very full and have never made it to dessert. Akahana is a must-try!

VrQg25I05DWVtrKWUPylKA.text: Stumbled upon a gem while on a weekend business trip. Ian, the manger was very friendly and welcoming. The bartender Dallas suggested the beef brisket pho and the seafood hot pot (so we listened) .... and it turned out to be BOMB! Customer service was super as well. We don't come to charlotte often; but when we do in the future, we will make sure to stop by this place again!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood hot pot
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apparently their pho is really good.... according to the bartender

aj_wgQJ9bP6S0HAG3rWQtg.text: Went in on a Saturday evening. The wait was about 15 minutes long but that wasn't bad at all considering it was dinner time. I ordered the sesame chicken and my girlfriend took advantage of the buy one get one promotion on the sushi rolls. The sesame chicken is so dank. It's not like the mushy sesame chicken you get from Chinese food places or from the the mall. It's crispy but not too much. The sauce is very good as well and not too sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

vOMsH36L5SebT_MUNwzVVA.text: Buy one get one free roll. Delicious sushi. Great prices. The service is great and friendly. It's a great hole in the wall that's tucked away in the corner.

Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

wB3NvZpuTfLM3Tqy0ywbGA.text: Very upset that the shrimp tempura wasn't deveined!! My shrimp were full of poop! $8 for poop infested shrimp thanks!

ieCPcH_QE57JupwbIbhcTg.text: LMAO.  Jesus christ these places need to stop with the whole BOGO DEAL.  YOU ARE NOT GETTING A DEAL.  THESE PLACES DOUBLE THEIR PRICES ON SUSHI ROLLS THINKING YOUR GETTING A DEAL.  Ive had bogo sushi in other areas but this is repulsive.  This sushi you can find at a buffet or a grocery store.  To other foodies who are trying this place for their 1st time.......skip it.  You can go to a buffet and get the same quality for half the price.  Even for bogo, their sizes for the rolls are smaller than what you will pay for  at another sushi spot for the same price.   Save the trouble and go somewhere else if you want to go here go to a chinese buffet instead.  You'll thank me later

J2v-pipSr-k2oL3XV-v7tw.text: This has been the worst sushi experience I have ever had. We arrived for an early dinner around 5:00 and we're seated in the dining room where there was just one additional party. We ordered soup and salad each, then two rolls (BOGO), and 6 pieces of nigiri (2 pieces each of salmon, tuna and white tuna. Soup and salad came out in about 10 minutes. It took over 45 minutes for our sushi to arrive. When it arrived there were two heaps of salmon roe rolled in seaweed as well was one tuna and one white tuna. We told the waiter we were supposed to have two pieces of each of tuna and that the salmon was supposed to be the nigiri salmon. We waited over 20 minutes for the correct salmon and additional two pieces of tuna. After the 20 minute mark passed I asked him to just cancel the order and bring the bill. That took almost 10 minutes and when he brought the bill we were charged for both rolls which are supposed to be BOGO and the salmon. If you're considering going here don't. This was my second time and the first they messed up but it was a busy Friday so I have them the benefit of the doubt.   Awful service. Subpar sushi. Just don't.

KmiYYcJkIdRS8ive9HOZ7Q.text: It honesty doesn't look like much from the outside, but I didn't expect it to look as it did on the inside.  BOGO sushi rolls was an awesome deal, and the ones I had were fresh and pretty good. I went during lunch so I can't speak for the dinner crowd but I'd definitely return or order takeout here.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. BOGO sushi rolls!

vwhqdiY-kw06-us-sLJ1xQ.text: Came here on Saturday for the first time with another couple.  Big Pro: BOGO sushi all the time!!  For a Saturday night, this place was pretty dead. My friend and I ordered the drink special for the day, orange creamsicle while the boys ordered beers (they seemed to have a handful of local beers available). Unfortunately, the Orance Creamsicle was a major letdown. Neither one of us liked it at all.....it tasted like some type of medicine!!  We started off with a spring roll each and an order of the crap wontons. Not a big fan of the crab wontons, maybe a bit to much creamcheese and not enough crab! The spring rolls were pretty good though.   We ordered 8 rolls for the 4 of us: a few Bagel rolls, a San Francisco Roll, a cruncy tuna roll, and a few others. They came out on this huge boat which was alot of fun. Someone sitting beside us actually asked to take a picture cause the boat was that cool!  Unfortunately, none of the rolls were that amazing. I mean, the San Francsico roll was by far the best. I loved that lemon on top. Such a light and refreshing roll. The rest were just ok. Not amazing. But not poor either. I don't feel like I have super snobby sushi tastes. Just wasnt a fan of Akahana.....maybe a bit too bland for my taste!

3hneZSI5OLAaHx5ufIwnIg.text: Akahana, finally a good BOGO sushi place! They have a good selection of rolls from $10-15, and then a monster lobster roll from $24. I've come here a couple of times with some friends who are regulars. We've ordered sake as well, the white peach is the best and Asian pear is disgusting. We had to switch out our sake the last time we were here, wasn't an issue when we approached management about the horrible tasting Asian pear sake. I like the fact that they have low carb and veggie options, not sure if they offer brown rice. I got the Butterfly roll (12) and the garden roll (10) last time I was here and was not disappointed. The butterfly roll is very hearty while the garden was light. I didn't want to go to heavy on the spicy mayo (even though I love it, damn diet). Total was around 22 for two rolls and a large sake carafe. I will be back for more.

neiV8vcDJPuRq05Tyds_CA.text: Delicious!!! Went the first time and got the fried oyster and the shrimp tempura sushi! It's was buy one get one free and also delicious!!!!! Came back today and tried the Sesame chicken with my boyfriend! We LOVED it! Can't wait to come back ( which may be tomorrow) haha!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Me and my boyfriend got the delicious sesame chicken w/ fried rica and side of creamy sauce ( shrimp sauce) ! Omg! Can&#39;t wait to go back!

3-tqyZLp8xsiLUM5qqCYlQ.text: One of my favorite Asian places in the QC. The bar is amazing and the sushi is great. Just say I love sushi.

bfLXsXPwhfsgYRhXDBwv4A.text: Got takeout - 4 rolls for $30 (BOGO all day everyday). It was just okay...kind of subpar. Especially the sashimi roll, there was hardly any fish in it. They didn't include any wasabi. The tuna was dry too. I wouldn't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi roll - where is the fish?

x-nwgeTYZZkIfL7H5OKFMw.text: I really love this place at times I mean it has my favorite roll in Charlotte... the Charlotte roll. It's not the best sushi in town but it's better than most at the price point. My problem with this place is that I'll call to make a to go order and almost every time i get a busy signal! When I finally get through to a person they put me on hold for a full minute. It's so frustrating! They also need more parking. That's why they get 3 stars from me. It's not the food it's the service. Even when I eat in the service isn't the best. However when the owner is there he visits every table in such a fun loving manor. Maybe I'm being harsh?

M73gr766dZtCRMTvYj_NiA.text: I love this place. And I honestly think the feeling is mutual. The staff and owner make me feel appreciated. Not to mention....the food is excellent. BOGO rolls and drink specials make it a great value as well. Best sushi spot in Plaza Midwood and NoDa.

GwqX23d2HaL61hrsA_3j9A.text: Excellent sushi here and a great deal for diners--buy one roll get one free. We have tried the orange blossom roll, crunchy tuna, sunflower and dragon rolls and liked the flavors of them all and the fresh nigiri and sashimi. They are a tiny place in the plaza Midwood area but the sushi is consistently delicious. They have good drink specials too. Servers are always friendly so stop by and get on a roll!

c873T3nd9wpOa5hyU57MJg.text: Their BOGO free sushi deal can't be beat since it's ongoing! The rolls are a good size and always delicious. The only downside I've experienced is the wait time. We've had to wait between 30-45 min for our food the past few times. We suspect that the servers have just forgotten to put our orders in but they've always been friendly so it's not a huge deal.

V5FJw527u1_Th6z3XqBXgA.text: Don't try Vietnamese food when you come to Akahana. I wonder the Owner is vietnamese? Very disappointed dinner last night, they used the food leftover few days old to served for us because it's stink and make me headache, Banh xeo was disaster, terrible. it was cold instead of hot and crispy, they used the leftover red roast pork from sandwiches and split boil shrimp from goi cuon ( spring rolls) for banh xeo( yellow crepe), all the dishes that I ordered that was bad. Pho was bad, too. Meat smell and not tender, salty, noodles still hard... look like they brought it out from refrigerator and didn't heat up... never come back here again

VenxRDzKWctdATmrR2lAew.text: 3 stars at most. I don't get why people give it 1 or 5. It's not God awful but it's not amazing. I had two rolls and a won ton soup with tea for 20$. The buy one get one rolls I picked weren't tiny. Maybe it's just certain ones but each one listed on the menu tells how many pieces. I recently had sushi at Ru San and it was comparatively better. I won't be back but I'm glad I tried it.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. One with tuna, one with salmon and shrimp tempura
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Won ton soup, large for 4.95

WSCGbdhKRaA29_q7JyiDHg.text: The private party room is cool and great for a party with friends!

AP_NLJkWZfRyMkIiXKD7Ng.text: The menu is very extensive, so if you don't prefer sushi there are many options to choose from. We did have sushi and it was great, it seemed very fresh (which is something you want in sushi).  The decor is warm and inviting. The service was great, no complaints. The only minor issue we had was that our second round of drinks took longer than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

C3FHlFSccKodqR5w7r9Rng.text: Good quality food. Great location for Plaza Midwood. The soup is fabulous.

OznG9KlpHPv6V_EvdWAw3Q.text: They get one star because the waitress was friendly and the first two drinks were good (dragon tail and pineapple margarita). After that, it was just bad, so I'll try to keep this short. Calamari, lukewarm and just "ok". Fried soft shelled crab, room temp. Explanation for crab temp was that kitchen did the fry job while the sushi chef did the plating and garnishing and the two weren't in synch. When I heard that, I thought it was one of the dumbest kitchen workflow plans I'd ever heard of. I mean, the garnish and plating was just the crab on top of lettuce. So, here's a novel idea ... why not do that first and have it ready for when the crab comes out the fryer?! Common sense. Right? Anyway, my wife ordered the seafood hot pot. It came out and some genius heated it in a way that the lid couldn't be removed due to internal vacuum inside the pot. Waitress had to take it back and get tech support to remove the lid. After tasting it, maybe it was God telling us not to even bother eating it. Oh, and did I mention that the menu said it would have snapper, but they put salmon in there instead (farm raised most likely)? I guess they figured we were too dumb to notice :) Anyway, I ordered the spicy basil dish. That was a fail. My wife ordered the ginger pear martini. That was a special kind of fail because it tasted like Victoria's Secret body scrub ... pear flavor of course. To end this on a positive note (kinda), I will say that the fried rice was good; just wished we knew there was a $1 up-charge for that when we ordered it. Geez. Anyway ... not going back.

wwl9aoSUxcJoTCT3AO5ktw.text: The selection of unique rolls is really what keeps me coming here. The crab wontons start off your meal perfectly,  because let's face it, how can those get messed up? On my most recent visit today, the trend of terribly lazy service continued. I was one of three total tables in the restaurant and was still getting no attention from our waitress. Ive put enough time in working at restaurants to know that serving sunday mornings at a sushi place is a walk in the park. We ordered a cali n spicy tuna to start, but we received a salmon and tuna roll instead. When the server returns with our "correct" order they merely squirted a bunch of sriracha sauce on the tuna roll to make it "spicy tuna." How lazy. Beverages were empty often and had to call out a mistake on the check of charging for an extra roll. I used to love this place since it was so close and convenient, but now the service is so consistantly bad I'm not sure if I will be going back.

rbxW4krfUJnqkDSP_QXbUQ.text: I went to Akahana on a Wednesday night with a friend and had the BEST waiter in the world and amazing sushi! Our waiter introduced himself to us and asked our names then every single time we started running low on our drinks he'd rush over to us and ask us by name if we would like another drink. He was on it! He suggested sushi to us and really knew the menu. The sushi was GREAT! Very fresh and not overly fishy. It is a little on the pricy side but worth every penny. I highly recommend this place and our waiter, Gaylin. Everything was so good that we ordered 7 different kind of rolls and endless drinks, our bill was over $100 and we didn't blink twice at it and we tipped Gaylin 50%! Can't wait to go back :)

VZXS7jkM-wvpgENmDtOqWw.text: I like the dollar PBR specials.  The food is great.  Very impressed with the new menu items.

VJPv_OKojbr-PAvmygQ09g.text: I was craving some basic sushi on my way back to Charlotte after a 4 hour drive.  I wanted something better than grocery store sushi, but didn't feel like driving any further than I had to since I just wanted to be out of the car.  Then I remembered that Akahana was right next to my house!  Perfect opportunity to give them a try.  I ordered a basic roll... salmon, cream cheese & avocado... and a seaweed salad.  Honestly, I wasn't very impressed.  The roll was decent, I mean it's hard to mess up something so basic, but it seemed like it was missing something... and the wasabi tasted watered down if that's even possible.  The seaweed salad was the crunchiest I've ever had and I'm undecided as to whether that is a good thing or a bad thing.  It had good flavor, just super loud!    Also, it was a Thursday, which the sign said BOGO... buy one get one... but I only had one roll in the box when I got home.  ???

-bbFNEpu1SaJDJKZPXH6fQ.text: We went here on a Wednesday evening and the ambiance was great.  Just the right amount of lighting.  Lots of tables for couples to larger groups.  I spotted a traditional Japanese dining room in the back, near the bathrooms, which would be a cool thing to do with a bunch of people.  The restaurant just opened so they didn't have draft beer yet but the hot tea was perfect for a cold winter night and the wine & mixed drink menu looked comprehensive.  Everything we ordered was very good - garlic crusted calamari, miso soup, three sushi rolls (Dragon which is shrimp/eel, spicy tuna, Mary which is like a California roll).  Service was very good - not pretentious - I think we saw some CAST actors working as well as some other Plaza Midwood neighborhood faces.  I hope this place survives since the location seems to be cursed like the Cursed Pirate Girl (Jeremy Bastian reference y'all).  And check out the used book store next door if you have time - just watch out for their puss who, like most pusses, can be cranky when approached the wrong way.  Cheerio!

HbXKcKpQBF9rRTI7xNtyTQ.text: Boo Hiss!  They changed BOGO Free to BOGO 1/2 price.  I hate when businesses build a following and then change the rules.  Sushi wasn't THAT great to begin with but BOGO was the appeal.  You're gonna lose us loyal customers; bad decision.

QJzS65cDfXHW41uETFfq0g.text: Est at this place quite often, but just now getting around to write a review.  I mainly get sushi when I go here, but have tried regular menu items a couple times.  The sushi is fantastic and at a great price (buy 1 get 1 Rolls everyday of the week)!!  The other menu items that I've tried have been good as well.  I would recommend this place to anyone

OdroiCn4gv-y0ygAlIkUSQ.text: My friends and I love this place. The food is OK for the price we always go with the bogo sushi rolls and share them among the table. The drink specials are pretty good. Overall its a good place to go with some friends to start a night out on the town.

wEEWlQ_3EbF4EUuA14Wa-g.text: Good food and service. Large menu with good variety. Atmosphere is decent enough.(not bad at all)Only downfall would be that the prices are a hair bit high. If they lowered the prices say by a dollar or so and got some hip music, I think that would definately help. Also like the previous poster stated they also need something on the walls just to make it more homely. Anyway I would recomend it and I wish them the best of luck.

ArMacP5EqRNjQhsMOGGQpA.text: My husband & I both live in Plaza Midwood and have been wanting a restaurant like this to show up for so long!!  We have been 3 times since they have opened.  While we have only had the sushi, it has always been very good.  The servers are very nice.  We would highly recommend this restaurant.  Very big menu ... even for those non sushi lovers.  I hope this place makes it as we will be back very soon!!  Please check out this restaurant and support Plaza Midwood!!

nBjUGRHJcdoyhceL7NrnHA.text: Alright, I'll be honest. I tried to overlook some aspects of the service the past few times. The best way I can describe every visit is awkward with the wait staff. It's like sometimes they try to hard and then sometimes not all. This past visit we had several mess ups and then felt rushed to leave at the end of our meal. It was only 8:30pm. Food is still great but I think it would serve them well to hire someone to really get the service up to speed. This would go a long way. I'm local and really want to see the place do well but these service issues can cause people to give up quick. I'm very patient but others probably not so much.

20MbSkS5dtvOLrN3CuFyUA.text: We went for lunch and the service was pretty bad.  All our food came out luke warm or cold and my friend found two hairs in her dish which had to be re-made.  The food was ok.

MUk1h5vD4Xj9OWa-SZoBgQ.text: I personally loved this new place!  They really spent time and money renovating the inside.  The first thing you see is an impressive Akahana statue type thing with flowing water, and a sushi bar.  We had really great service the two times we went from both the bartender and the server.  Honestly, I went for sushi both times so I didn't look at the other menu, but the sushi menu is very extensive! People had mentioned this place was slightly expensive, but the rolls are huge!  The spicy tuna roll (and it really is spicy) was only $5!  The specialty rolls really aren't very expensive when you take into account that each has a ton of meat inside AND on top.  They also have a beautiful presentation, each roll wrapped in something delicious like seared ahi tuna or avocado slices.  The best part is the $4 sake bombs!  They have specials every day, with B1G1 specials on Tuesdays and Thursdays.  I can't wait to go back and I hope this place sticks around!

TQlFisXidE4j1IiiksQCTQ.text: You can't go wrong with their buy one, get one free special that they run EVERYDAY. Nowhere in CLT does that. Their Golden Gate and Hurricane Rolls are two of my favorites and they also have pretty good drink specials like $5 glasses of sangria on saturdays so definitely go check them out!

z3upOslmoA8lf94X5M8NGw.text: I haven't been here in a while, and I didn't have good memories of it. We wanted sushi, but didn't want to drive all the way to ru sans. I wish I did now.   The first bad omen was the mold on the menu. Black mold growing from moisture and stickiness in the menu. Guh-ross!!   I ordered the tropical exotic roll. The menu description was so misleading it made it seem like the soy paper would be cut in designs, but the roll was actually like a sushi quesadilla, but not in a good way.   The other roll I got was meh... The crab tasted like crab out of a can, it wasn't even the imitation krab, which I typically dislike but would've been better.   All in all, I'll probably never come back here. Even with bogo sushi. I see why it's bogo, they want to get rid of it as much as I disliked it.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mold in the menu.

ywZ3FXrrKN1pkPYGJfy5wA.text: Even worse than before.  Prices have gone up. Service is terrible. Smells strange like mold when you walk in. Unfriendly staff.  Food wasn't that great either.

w-G3OyHjY-TFM4CMlqIM5w.text: Before I begin, I will mention that I have worked in the restaurant business for years and I am going to be polite but firmly honest.   We came because a friend liked their BOGO special. But, apparently this place is popular just because of the location and prices.   We will never be coming back. We didn't even stay to eat. Service was so slow and sanitation was so bad that we left (something we have never done). The table next to us ordered after us but were served multiple items before we even got our beers (which took forever). We put cash on the table for our two beers and then left because our waiter never came back. After leaving, we went to our usual, go-to sushi place.   I would dismiss these issues as being the innocence of a rookie server, but the sanitation was also a problem. The tables and bathroom were gross and there was trash all over the men's bathroom because nobody had tended to it in a long time.   This is not the place where I want to eat raw fish. Again, I'm trying my best to be polite here, but this experience was exceptionally bad.

N0COf3_CsM6uOsi0hEpEfA.text: Stopped in here because I had a desire for Asian and my friend wanted fried rice. We walked in about 7:45 pm to a messy restaurant, but were seated right away. Great I thought! Dinner rush usually means things are on point. I ordered signature dish, spicy basil with chicken. She ordered deluxe fried rice.   No more than 5 minutes passed and our food was at the table. This is NOT a good sign. Rice was hot, but everything else was luke warm (including meats not at temp). We mentioned this and they took our food back. Not 1 minute more and it was back to our table....nice and microwaved.  The hostess came over, and I said, "Hey, food that is this quick can't be fresh." We sent the food back and it was sent back to us less than a minute! Even fried rice takes more than 5 mins between ordering and completion." The hostess said,  "I am sorry but we can't make everything fresh during dinner."  Lose. What a poor example of existence. So many other choices....

pQ9XspT1-OgCvqCf4jt9ww.text: I like Akahana because it's not pretentious, but still makes an attempt at being.. well something. It's not nice enough for a special occasion, despite the candles on the table. It's not a hip place to hang out, despite the dim lighting and Justin Timberlake booming over the PA system.    The food is consistently fine.. I'm never disappointed, but never blown away.   But.. you can't beat the BOGO deal. Sure, a house special Roll will set you back $15, but then you get another free and that's a cheap date or lunch for tomorrow or a late night snack after the bar.  Akahana is great for a weekday dinner or takeout after a hectic day at the office... Hang out at the fully stocked bar while you wait and enjoy the Timberlake.

GGRNoUZHq-ifDSz5Pjf6Ew.text: I was so disappointed in this place.  I read some iffy reviews AFTER already being there! Big mistake!! The waitress was friendly & the food came out quick.  The veggie dumplings seemed good.  The crab wonton also seemed ok.  My friend had the tropical roll...gross!!! Gross gross!!! He said it tasted like a warm tuna sandwich! It smelled sooooo bad.  I also had a jalapeno margarita that was just terrible!!!! It tasted like pure sour mix, no spice at all.  As soon as I left, my stomach started hurting.  It hurt the entire night so bad that I had to go home.  I got sick later and stayed sick the remainder of the night and AM. I have never had food poisoning, but I suspect I may have gotten a touch of it! The bathrooms here were disgusting by the way...YUCK!!!!!!!!!

Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yuck! Soggy sushi bars!?

c47nb8mxfofDz1MBJ32WTA.text: I ordered the $14 Lotus Blossom and Orange Blossom sushi rolls with salmon and tuna but a few of the pieces were missing fish and they were tiny to begin with. Definitely NOT worth it and it took an hour to get them.

twKEV9grsT7NWVwvIFdv7A.text: Delicious! I ordered the Buffalo Roll and Cherry Blossom Roll and it was awesome. They have the BOGO all week long and pretty amazing specials. Great for date night or just to have a quick bite. Doesn't take as long as you average sushi place.

-7kMKGC1AAoJf_WUNAr7yw.text: One of the few places in the area that has BOGO sushi. Hallelujah. They also have a great patio area outside and daily drink specials. Our server was awesome. Wasn't super impressed by the sushi, we had Spiral Ecstasy, Mango Tango, Florida and Furious Dragon maybe? Also started with summer rolls and edamame. They were both fantastic and the summer rolls are 2 for $4.45.  Gets the job done when you want sushi but don't want to spend $100 for 2 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

FYUH0T4CT7qmL0ZypQl-pw.text: Akahana is a reliable option for sushi and takeout in Plaza Midwood. The BOGO sushi rolls everyday include an extensive list of options so you don't have to get the same ones each time. The BOGO is also offered for takeout. The Vietnamese bun is also pretty good and is of good size. The spicy edamame are excellent.   The service has historically been hit or miss but has been more reliable of late. There are drink specials most days, but they aren't always that enticing (like 15% off sake and $1 off beer).   The atmosphere is ok but occasionally it may smell like cleaner (really the only reason for not getting 5 stars). Will continue to eat here for (generally) good value sushi and Asian fare.

9SZ9f-nFDEnhmwOZ8yuQAQ.text: I was here for the first time a couple days ago. The staff was very friendly and the food was delicious. I was amazed at their buy one get one free sushi rolls deal..Their spicy edamame was the bomb..Will definetly we returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

C6w941EYJWGkhu74_JHBmg.text: Amazing sushi! A friend and I came here after work to try it out and had a very positive experience. The sushi is fresh and you can't beat the buy one get one deal. Ian, the new manager came by several times to make sure we were having a pleasant experience and even cracked some jokes to get us laughing.   I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone in the Charlotte area. I'm completely confident in saying this sushi is the bomb

zFg9TfQR7TAN3JsqGzgf2Q.text: This place had tasty sushi and a great atmosphere. It was busy , but had plenty of room . Everyone was enjoying themselves and the service was great . The BOGO rolls was a nice addition . We had rolls , hand rolls , sashimi, several soups , and seaweed salad . All were very good , I enjoyed that the rice around the rolls was on the thinner side . It really made the roll more enjoyable that you could taste the difference in the rolls and not just rice . The soups were amazing ! Try this place .

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sashimi eel . Tasty
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seaweed Salad was delicious !
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Scallops

IqMW7KBWeJARup8zSyd0kw.text: Our go to sushi spot! Love the spicy edamame appetizer and always get the spiral ecstasy roll. They have the best BOGO on sushi. The new female bartender is great as well as all the employees. The owner is almost always there and very friendly and attentive. They also have great drink specials that change daily and lots of local drafts to choose from.

KZdijhlMbLzoz8z74nLSAg.text: Buy one, get one sushi rolls. That means one thing to me: I should probably order four rolls. Right? RIGHT?!   Spoiler alert: I can't eat four rolls by myself. I gave it my best shot though.   My latest trip here was for take out grub. I walked in after yoga. Hot mess express over here. I posted up at the bar, ordered myself a glass of Prosecco and dove into the overwhelming menu.   My selections: Spicy spider, Spiral Ecstasy, Watermelon, and Cherry Blossom rolls. The Spicy spider and Spiral Ecstasy were the winners. I love rolls wrapped in cucumber instead of rice. Unfortunately, the cucumber didn't look all that appealing for the Watermelon.  Four rolls + one glass of Prosecco = $38. I could've easily been okay with just two rolls.   The bartender was super friendly and attentive. He helped me go through the endless list of options. Call it the never-ending menu. I would gladly sit at the bar any time he was working for a meal.  Akahana is a decent little sushi spot. Nothing too fancy. Rolls aren't super creative. Great specials throughout the week. Worth a trip if you're craving sushi in the Plaza Midwood 'hood.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cherry blossom, spiral ecstasy, watermelon and spicy spider rolls

DwjcZvDBC4zZhm0lsnK27w.text: We were in Charlotte for one day and our friend told us about the BOGO rolls. The rolls come out to be the same price as other restaurants because they are small maki rolls. We eat sushi in every town we visit, and this one did not blow us away. We like to revisit places we love, but we will look for a different sushi next time we are in Charlotte.

_Vl5v4gKJyqiFLKUzyV6eA.text: This is Belmont's newest restaurant and tonight they were packed.  We waited 20 minutes or so for a seat and it was worth the wait.  Our server, Andi (yes with an I he told us) was friendly and efficient with our orders. The food was excellent and plentiful. We will go back again and do highly recommend it.  The only drawback is that it was noisy, but the food and the service was well worth it.

bG0FRp2muRWAI1xCsAw0GQ.text: Great value. Not the absolute best sushi but very tasty and you get a lot for your money

0M-6LUpfbQYSyPY3SDVURw.text: I've been to this place a few times over the past few years and only got sushi for their special. Went last night with some friends for a birthday and everyone else ordered things other than sushi. They all looked and tasted soooo good!! Sake-tinis were awesome! I must go back soon just to get something other than sushi.   Customer service was decent. Restaurant pretty clean. Quality of food was good and the low prices were excellent!!!

NyoZuK65huGDLQ6GAWgGtw.text: Great place for sushi. The rolls are 2 for 1 at lunch. Had the furious dragon roll and it was the best sushi I've ever had. Will definitely be returning. The decor was beautiful and the service was awesome.

Eig-aK323cmduG6xv4Jspw.text: The service was good, but that was about it.  I wanted something asian for lunch and was on my way to the wonderful dim sum place down central when I saw BOGO sushi.  So, I stopped and went in.  The fish at the sushi bar looked good, so I decided to eat there.  The ambiance felt like it was recently something else and they just painted over it and added a fountain.  It took a second for me to be seated, but my waitress was quite responsive.  I opened the sushi menu to see that most of the rolls were about twice the price they should be(at least for this side of town), so this BOGO was really "you have to buy twice as much to get it for the normal price."  I tried to order some hand rolls, but they said that wasn't included in BOGO.  So, then I tried to order some nigiri, that wasn't included either.  I asked, why does it say BOGO sushi, and the waitress told me sushi meant rolls.  I quickly corrected her and stated that no, sushi means rice.  I probably shouldn't have done that, but I don't like misinformation.  I was feeling kind of cheap but was really hungry so I went with the hibachi chicken.  There were many other options, and I guess I chose the worst.  First I got my salad, nothing special, but not bad.  Then came my food, a nice sized plate of food.  Little bits of chicken and such with a nice sized order of rice.  Oh, it was so dry, I really didn't enjoy it at all.  I guess I should have gone with the over-priced sushi, but I doubt I will return to find out.  Sorry guys, there are sooooo many sushi places in town these days, gotta get me on the first impression.

T3rU29tgLzS7elRAA7li2w.text: I have already gone twice this week.  This is now one of my top 3 sushi places. The service has been polite and timely.  The sushi itself is really good and they offer BOGO free all day.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front- Sunset Toll (favorite), Sides- Ahi Haiwii and in the back Bay of Gulf Roll.

U87futD-ZDSsYCiQcPks8Q.text: I have had mostly mediocre to just plain horrible service at Akahana - yet its close proximity to my home keeps me coming back, mostly now for take-out.   I do love some of their rolls, even when they mess up my order its usually still good. The BOGO offer (all day every day eat in or take out)can work in your favor, and sometimes you're not saving anything. Fancy rolls? sure, definitely could use a half off. Generic/veg rolls? No thanks. Yeah, I'm getting half off my california roll but they charge $9 to begin with, double what other sushi joints charge, so not really a great steal.   I'm slowly venturing off their sushi menu. I really like their hot and sour soup, a lot. The stirfrys are alright. I've tried almost every appetizer and although I don't have a favorite, I also don't have a "never order again"... though the ginger dressing on the house salad is more often than not so bitter it ruins everything, so I usually skip that.   I'd like to go in and enjoy my meal more often, but even when there's only one other table I still can't get my server to pay attention to me, so I'd rather just skip the whole "service" part. And it's really nice they're open late on the weekends!

I-H88u0kF-f9aBjpus9IoQ.text: So excited to find great sushi on this side of town. The soup and salad portions exceeded our expectations and the sushi was amazing. BOGO was too good to be True. Excellent staff and even the general manager stopped by to ensure our experience couldn't be any better. We will return soon.

tP-PuEZqkrgNlBIf7MU5WA.text: I have been here multiple times. I love the BOGO sushi deal and the spicy edamame. However, on my last visit I ordered hot green tea. When the bartender brought it to me, it was green tea from Costco. Sitting at the bar, you see people from the kitchen bringing food from the kitchen to the sushi bar. None of the employees were wearing gloves and touching the food with their hands. After seeing that they serve Costco tea, it makes me question the quality of their sushi.

7mT4Xn-45OCi7pZ0UaJ0QA.text: The sushi is amazing and the service is great! It's not amazingly flavorful but it's bogo and Delicious for a last minute date! The dragon roll is delicious. Ive never really tired any of the other options besides sushi but the other options seem delectable also!

FZGrKq_JwvCz102SVF1uIQ.text: I've been coming to Akahana for my sushi since I moved to Charlotte a year ago. Im a picky eater and found rolls here that I love and get every time. The service is hit or miss and in the past year I've come here quite a few times and haven't been impressed with food to say the least. But for some reason, I continue to go back. I ordered some food Togo for the first time in over a month and was very impressed. The rolls were great and so was the fried rice. I hope they have gotten through their subpar phase because I love coming here and I love that's it's so close to home.

96OdevHrxbncMWPqhAYayg.text: I'm going to give this a solid 4 because of the economical nature of it.  It is in no way high class sushi.  But, it's honestly better, in my opinion, than many of the other expensive sushi places in Charlotte.  Get the simple menu if they offer if you're like me and don't want cream cheese in you're f***king sushi.  If you do that, with their everyday bogo, it boils down to like $4.50 a roll.

6G3CyUmVCinYtyfY8pbNQQ.text: Akahana has a wide selection but food is pretty average. Their sushi isn't great but isn't bad.  It's one of those places you go to when nobody in your group can decide on where to go for dinner because of it's wide selection.

JBBvKpwsvL5d9A5GrN1tfA.text: You can't beat all day every day buy one get one free sushi that's actually really good. A great place I love to frequent when I'm in the neighborhood. Good for large groups or a quiet date. Spicy edamame, soups and salads are all good starters. On my last visit, we asked our server about the sake and she basically explained she didn't know much about it and whatever she did tell us honestly made us more confused. But other than that, the food came out fast, was delicious and a great value.

rVq9RIXeNbbR5_RX2MPBCg.text: Being in the area, I decided to order pick-up for lunch and was pleased with meal, however found it just lay for the prices. Overall seemed a little high for the amount of food. I would like to dine in and check out a few more selections...so, look for an updated review soon.

0wRwMX5PVMUvVyUfZrgwWQ.text: I've lived here in Plaza Midwood for a couple years and haven't tried this restaurant yet. Now I know why. Ordered the vegetable fried rice. One small bit of egg, 2 pieces of broccoli, and hardly anything else. Not what I consider VEGETABLE fried rice. Very disappointed:/

0YMP0k-rHQiJcHhoC4h7CQ.text: I was craving sushi last week so I finally decided to try this place out and...I am a FAN! First of all, how can you dislike BOGO 1/2 off sushi rolls?! I'm pretty sure they offer this daily. They have a ton of specialty rolls to choose from (yes, even vegetarian) as well as a myriad of other asian fusion dishes. The drinks are delicious too. If you're a fan of electro music then they've got you covered as well.   So glad I live near this place because I will DEFINITELY be back!

t36GOIQTZnbYMnfprT56QQ.text: Went back with El Husbando and discovered that:  Unsurprisingly, rolls are half the size on BOGO night.   Anything labeled "small/large" can be ordered in those proportions during dinner hours - "lunch/dinner" cannot.  Ma Po tofu is brown sauce with dried red pepper flakes. Still nowhere in CLT making this dish properly.  Akahana performed up to its solid, safe pan-Asian rep. Let's see if it lasts.

CNBpUZPRxpuWmp86GcCvOg.text: Definitely one if my favorite sushi spots. I'm from Cali, and I'm always afraid of trying sushi in different states but I have to admit that the hurricane roll is my absolute favorite!

CuOvKC2XB6N3MPAH5SFvxQ.text: My favorite date spot for the price. Sushi is Always fresh and visually stunning. Service has been rough before, so now we just go to the bar. Edwin, the bartender is awesome. Saketinis are surprisingly tasty. Cant beat the quality matched with affordability. Good to see something Good that location since the graduate.

sB7o8vW17nWB_v4XAk9PzQ.text: This update is for their lunch special.  $5 awesomeness is what it is. My first try was the curry chicken, it was the biggest plate of food I never expected. While it took a little longer to get the food out, it's still a great deal.  And mind you, it was a Saturday.  Yes, lunch special is available on weekends too.  My 2nd try was during the week.  I called ahead to place my order (magnolia beef) to cut out wait time. I showed up and the food rolled out. This time the portion wasn't as big but still very satisfying. Service was solid both times.  And the food tasted good with consistent quality.  They actually have sushi lunch special too, all $5.  I swear this place is a keeper.

fuL9BoOcYY8mXCddZVGj8Q.text: What I ordered to go: Stir fried vegetables with chicken and no mushrooms, light white sauce, brown rice; spring rolls.  What I got: bland, over cooked vegetables with gloppy corn starch sauce.  Spring rolls were ok.

3WUDf8Bk5HNtij2S1SMWOQ.text: I'll never go back to akahana. The service was awful. One of my friends got the calamari.  It was undercooked so my friend called the manager. The manager actually argued with us about it. My drink was spilled accidentally. Usually places will give you another drink. Not Akahana. Took forever with our bills.  The sushi was mediocre.

baYvnzvxjYWGbikJvMbAEg.text: We had an amazing time last night at Akahana! The food was great, service awesome and everything tasted so fresh! I would totally recommend for anyone who is looking for a well priced sushi spot to go here! BOGO sushi is the only way to go!  So impresses!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

tJ6ZSb-r61quirzl90xggA.text: Meh if you want sushi in the plaza area and don't want to drive anywhere then I guess this place would be acceptable in a crunch, but I wouldn't go here as a destination. Friend suggested we try this place out since they do BOGO sushi. Great love a good deal and fresh sushi!   Unfortunately, Akahana offered neither of these things. First the sushi is definitely Americanized in terms of everything having cream cheese, panko, spicy mayo, and being deep fried. Yes, they have a few rolls that are not adulterated with saturated fat, but for the most part it is very heavy on American style sushi. Great for some people, not my style.   Secondly, their BOGO offer is a sham. Ordered two rolls as they are BOGO at about $14-16 a pop. I'm expecting a decently sized and well prepared roll for $15. Unfortunately the rolls come out and mine was missing the crab on top - didn't say anything because our waitress was never to be seen again. Additionally the rolls were extremely small in terms of filling. In most other sushi joints the same roll would go for about $6-8. So if you do the math on that ....you aren't really getting BOGO in terms of value. You are being sold an idea of BOGO predicated on inflated prices that ensure you're paying full market value for each roll. Don't get me wrong, I get this is a business and profit is important, but come on? $16 for a small roll that isn't even prepared with all the listed ingredients? Then you try to convince me I'm getting a deal by getting a second subpar roll?   I won't be back personally since I could get the same sushi cheaper at Harris Teeter across the road.

K4bSjzZ4oJC6Tc5q3OF6vQ.text: While the BOGO sushi is a good deal, the selection is poor.  Other sushi places have a much bigger variety.  The Pad Thai had little taste, the noodles were overcooked.  Service was lackluster.  Not a place I will revisit.

HEB26wXMmMnEi9PNlB4_Ig.text: I'm obsessed with their spring rolls and their BOGO sushi rolls! Our waitress was amazing even when we came close to closing time. Our food was fresh and exactly what i wanted. Can't wait to come back

oy-0zbunoLC_eA6cW9cTeA.text: Akahana...hmm. There's not really many positive things I can say about this place.  I was in the mood for sushi and saw on Yelp that they have a daily, BOGO deal on their sushi - even for take out orders - which sounded good to me.  They are located in a strip mall right across from the Plaza Harris Teeter. Based on the time of day, the parking lot can get tight and spots fill up quickly.  When I walked in, I was hit with a strong body odor aroma. Oddly it was only at the entrance. Once I walked inside, the stench was gone. At the hostess desk, I placed my order for two rolls: the Florida and furious dragon rolls. My total for both came to $16 and change. While I waited, I noticed how unkempt they keep the restaurant. Everything needs to be renovated.  The hostess brought me my food and once I got home, I was pretty disappointed that avocado pieces on my furious dragon roll were already turning brown. The sushi rolls tasted no better than what can be found in the sushi section of the Harris Teeter across the street.

9ihKdawb8EiIYwnqFgZOrQ.text: We really enjoyed this restaurant. All of their sushi rolls are buy one get one free, so you can get two specialty rolls for $15. It's a great deal for the quality sushi they serve. We got the Golden Gate/San Francisco roll and the Maui Wowie roll. We loved both of them. The flavors worked great together. We also got the Shrimp Pineapple fried rice which we loved. It was served with half of a hollowed out pineapple which was a cool touch. If you're looking for good sushi at a great price, you should definitely check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Maui Wowie Roll and San Fransisco Roll
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Pineapple Fried Rice

5sRht5S1SI0DkuCDWixkgg.text: Probably my favorite sushi place in town. The prices are good the staff is great and they have a lot of really wonderful choices.  The pho is very good but also,, I have never had a sushi option that has not been wonderful.  It is all good at a great price

QMCjgBjKjqhIMJU3rNnR3g.text: A decent sushi spot. We ordered the Furious Dragon roll (loved it), Surf and Turf roll (it was okay), Charlotte roll (loved it) and Mahina roll (did not like). Service was kinda slow (eventhough it wasn't really busy) but everyone we talked to was nice.   Bottom line: not my favorite sushi spot (shout out Cowfish!) but not the worst in Charlotte. If we want sushi near our house, we will go here and stick to the rolls we liked.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Top plate: furious dragon and surf and turf rolls Bottom plate: Charlotte and Mahina roll

X9KjvK33h2Cyz11aCfsp7Q.text: Inconsistent. I have come here and had great sushi and then today, it was the opposite. The sushi wasn't bad, or fishy, but it also just wasn't good. I got the Florida roll, and the tempura "crunchies" tasted more like a slice of bread inside my roll. They all kind of tasted like rice than the fish and veggies that you should taste. The service was wonderful, but it did take longer than usual to get our food, and there wasn't a crowd. Their BOGO deal is good, especially when you factor the cost of one roll. If you're in Plaza and don't want to travel around the city, it's still a decent spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. The ahi Hawaii roll and the Florida roll (right)
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. My husband&#39;s rolls. The right is the cherry blossom.

Oakkz3VZCcnu4TAo4ArBdA.text: Arrived at 11pm, sat at the sushi bar, not busy, all sushi is pre cut into paper thin pieces in the cooler.  At least we know the bacteria is on ALL the sushi and not just the ends.  I asked the sushi chef if he had any special rolls with eel sauce and tuna.  He recommended the cherry blossom roll.  The roll came out fast, had salmon and avocado in it and paper thin tuna on top with ZERO eel sauce.  The avocado was brown... not fresh.  This is not an upscale restaurant contrary to the description given on google maps.  Friendly service, quick service, over priced not fresh food.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paper thin, not fresh, not worth it.

etkRNPIo4vE_JHC5mlp-Tg.text: The Mongolian beef that I got to go was SO spicy that it was inedible. This is typically a dish that I love from here but was so disappointed in my meal last night. Other than that the spicy edamame was great per usual.

FomFP7Z8KYS8PpIKv3jXOQ.text: Was in the Plaza area of town this afternoon so I stopped into Akahana for sushi. I was met by a young lady who had an upbeat, bubbly vibe. She was very professional & made sure I had everything I needed throughout my time there. I sat at the sushi bar and had nice conversation with one of the chefs, who is opening his own Akahana in Belmont soon. The thinly sliced fish in the prep station looked fresh and was very colorful. I had the Raging Demon roll & the special Stupid Cupid roll. Both had eel, which I favor and were tasty & thankfully, solidly packed so it didn't fall apart (pet peeve of mine when it comes to sushi). However, I always enjoy alittle fresh, chilled ginger to finish my meal but their's was tainted beige and browning on some edges. Now here's my primary complaint: the odor in there is nasty; That dirty floor, wipe-counters-with-the-same-rag-over & over again- kind of smell. Now, I know I'm somewhat OCD clean & germ conscientious & I challenge myself to tone that down.  So I dug deep & stayed and ate but I prayed I wouldn't get sick all the way home! I know I  can't be the only one who senses some slacking in cleanliness there.  BOGO so I had two 8-pc.rolls for $15.00 + $6 tip (on the full amt., as is customary) = $21.00 and I was stuffed. Will I go back? Nope....no need to. Too many other, sparkling clean sushi places to visit!  3.5 out of 5 because the rolls were good and the staff was excellent. They just need to hire a new cleaning company to use some vinegar/bleach & steam that place from top to bottom. Or refinish and update the interior  :- /

COi50pYoQedyu795FDcF3Q.text: Asian food is always at the top of my list! I loved Akahanana, we stopped in for a late night beverage and snacky food - it was a good choice, friendly service, good prices, yummy good, great drinks, not much more you could ask for.

-P5am6FsC03akTKI7fpK0Q.text: Located in a dingy strip mall, it would be easy to overlook Akahana - but, you would be missing out on some very tasty food.  I eat here a couple of times a month and always enjoy my meal.  Akahana is most often reviewed for their BOGO sushi rolls, and while the sushi is fine - I prefer to dig in to the rest of their menu. There are a number of items on the main menu that really standout, including the Signature Pho served with thinly sliced steak served on the side to allow you to determine how long you want the steak to cook in the pho, the seafood hot pot with snapper, shrimp and scallops in a light oyster sauce, the red curry (I like it with the tofu), the spicy tuna/avocado bowl and the vietnamese crepe.    Pho tip - if you don't want a bowl full of noodles, you can ask them to sub veggies for the noodles for a couple dollar upcharge.  On those days I'm watching my carbs (they come and go), this is an excellent option!  For dining in, try to get a table on the right side of the restaurant (the bar side).  The left side of the restaurant has harsh fluorescent lighting and a completely different feel to it.    If you order takeout, be prepared to wait.  The orders often pile up and it can take a while for the host/hostess to sift through all of them.  Also, be sure to check your takeout order before leaving - as, sometimes special requests to the orders slip through the cracks.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mixed seafood pho
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood hot pot

mdPN_JOf2A5074U_5hm4ng.text: Don't order to go food from their to go menu online. Sounds ridiculous but it is True. The to go menu prices on their website are wrong and my ticket was $15 higher than planned. $15? Not a big deal to some however it is still misleading and False advertising.  The "manager" even expressed that their web designer is the reason the to go menu is wrong but that I should have ordered from the dine in menu.  Let me cuss for a second. WHY the eff would I order off the dine in menu when I called in a to go order?  The to go menu is still active and yes the prices are still less than the dine in menu. This is just bad management and the most insulting customer service.    They stay fully packed and are busy and have unique food but they lost a hospital worker and this hospital workers' coworkers orders from now on.

JyiRv9LCRCXHtvof0z2kRw.text: I heard great things and was glad we tried it out my son wanted to come back before we even got our food based on the attentiveness of our waiter. The pho and sushi was great. The Bellini was not too shabby either.
