3DQW44C7J1OMM0mJ-PgAbA.text: I had a really great time on a date here. I was placed at a table with a nice view from the window where you could see the stop light of Central Ave and The Plaza. They have a cute and dark atmosphere going on in the evening time. I had the rainbow roll and the spiral ecstasy roll. The rainbow roll did not have the wide assortment of fish I was expecting, but it only seemed to have tuna, shrimp, salmon, and some other pale fish. All of it was delicious though. My review is missing one star because it was awfully muggy in the establishment and it was uncomfortable. Otherwise, the food, atmosphere, and staff was nice.

1JxxcY4IuE9anlf9qzD6Ag.text: They have excellent Pho Dac Biet! But their keg was frozen so I could not get the beer special of the day and had to get a glass of Stella instead. Next time I'm in the area I will try their sushi.  ddc

dehyFi2J3qdlJP0iydsUhw.text: We decided to try this place after a recommendation and several reminders from our favorite server at Carpe Diem.    The quality of food at Akahana matched my expectations.  I rarely have high expectation for restaurants that have huge menus and broad food styles.  Akahana serves up the usual suspects from the usual Asian countries, and they do an admirable--though definitely not spectacular--job with their food.    My pho was tasty.  I've certainly had much, much better pho, but, as previously mentioned, I never expected to consume the best of anything here.  Ginny had a few sushi rolls, all of which I considered to be on par with similar items at Sushi 101.   If you're in the area and you're hungry for a decent meal, Akahana fits the bill.  If your expectation is to have the most fabulous Asian dish you've ever experienced, this will not fit the bill.

aKosqLa-ldFVV0uFl_0l_Q.text: Is this my favorite sushi place? No. Is it a great value for sushi? Yes. I visit Akahana mostly because it is walking distance to my house and they have Buy One, Get One Free rolls EVERY DAY. And this is why my boyfriend and I continue to frequent Akahana. That and their stellar drink specials. Their sushi is pretty good to just ok. We have finally got down pat the four rolls we like best- and order these every time. I can't wait to try the new pho they are now offering too.

K5xJYKhreXMmt1-Ayyqswg.text: After four visits, I'm still not sure how to feel about Akahana.  The portions are generous, the drink specials tend to be good, and the sushi is very solid.  The service is less awesome, and the chef is kind of a [euphemism].  Does this add up to a 3?  Let's see:  The menu seems to be around 55 pages long.  Maybe not 55 pages, but it's a tome.  There are a wide variety of southeast-asian dishes; some you're familiar with, some you likely aren't.  Everything I've had has been solid but not exemplary, nothing's been bad, and I've never sent anything back.  (Except for a bottle of sake once -- it had gone south, it was awful, and I really don't want to think about it.)  The sushi's quality is good, but not as good as can be had elsewhere for the appropriate premium.  I'd say it's fairly priced, maybe even a little cheap if you count the buy-one get-one-free sushi roll nights (Tuesday and Thursdays, limited selection of rolls).  Some of the rolls are creative, some standard.  The spicy tuna is, as advertised, spicy.  The atmosphere seems to be aiming for somewhere this side of a dance club.  Given some of the upright glass and the half-height dividers, it's perfect for a John Wu-style gun-fu shootout, especially with their typical music selection, which the kids might refer to as 'phat beats'.  I'm not sure whether this is a plus or a minus.  It's not a place where you're going to have a serious conversation.  The service is, as mentioned above, less than stellar.  Often inattentive, obviously disinterested, not guaranteed to have heard what you ordered, but definitely not stressed about remembering it.  Plentiful parking, and next to an incredibly well-supplied collection of wallet-draining used books.  Easy to get in and out of.  Summary: Good food but not fantastic, iffy service, John Wu.  3.

_jZFuFEpEJ-QM-xkD6wW5Q.text: I live nearby but have never been to this restaurant.  Finally went last night and loved it.  My friends had sushi and I had Pad Thai.  The Pad Thai was excellent.  This place may be a regular.  It has takeout too!

dN0ojLhldEr1UrxywZ4NKQ.text: FYI to everyone..BOGO is EVERY nite now..don't know if thats a good thing or a harbinger of trying to get more business 'cause they're struggling.  This is REALLY a 3.5 star review (why can't YELP get software to let u do 1/2 stars?). Have eaten there many times, and all the sushi/sashimi I've eaten there has been really good..soups too....and I'm a big guy (6'2" 275) and I don't know where the complaints about small portions comes from; i can order 2 rolls and a bowl of miso soup and be full. Plus they run GREAT cheap drink specials on beer and liquor drinks (a $3 Yukon Jack drink in a regular glass thats a good stiff drink..C'Mon, thats killer!!) As far as service I've never had BAD service, most of the time is decent to pretty good, they're always really friendly, and as far as helpful, itsa daily BOGO menu; the ingredients are on the menu and how its fixed; thrift a litlte CAY-ASH and go out on a limb and try something new, if u don't like it you've haven't spent much money.  I DO agree the "Night @ the Roxbury" club trash music thumping in there at 7PM is a LEEEEETLE much...maybe after 10pm guys????

xAaX0gWI6Yk1rZYEtKbfyw.text: One spider roll with greasy limp crab and iceberg lettuce please.  No thanks.

urQBvCMWMVfyweTlLDkYGw.text: First of al the buy one one, get one half off isn't as sweet as if sounds. Most of their rolls priced on the higher end, especially considering. But hey if the sushi is worth it I'll pay. That was not the case with this place. We started our meal with spring rolls. They were what was typically expected, except the shrimp wasn't deveined..yuck! After that we order two rolls. I got the crunchy tuna roll. I did enjoy that they put panko it, so I was able to get the crunch without it being fried. It was topped with avocado, which wasn't very fresh. It's certainly not something I'd order again. The service was friendly and fast. Although I didn't enjoy their sushi, I wouldn't be opposed to trying some of their other cuisine.

8yaGRxecJpLHJVHiyE8xTA.text: The Good:  The vibe is good inside- especially considering that it is in a strip mall. It does not look like Cuban Pete's or any of the other restaurants that have died there. It looks good.  There is a random hidden room (near the bathrooms) that looks like it would be a great room for a private party.  The sushi is average to above average. I had the Floridian- I thought it was good, it could have been spicier though.  The menu is big- so non-sushi friends can still tag along.  The prices are reasonable- on Tuesdays and Thursdays a lot of the sushi is half off.  I want to like this place. I want a little sushi place in Plaza Midwood- people want this to work.  The Bad:  It is average. The only reason why I will go back is because it is so close to my house and the competition is not strong in the area.  The waitress was sweet. Incredibly sweet. However, she informed us that she does not eat sushi. She did not know the menu. She was unable to offer suggestions. She looked in over her head. It was like having a vegan server at a steak house. It just didn't work.  I think this place can do well- even with average sushi- but they really need to have better service. Average food and average service does not make a lasting restaurant in a strip mall.

0BHIC0h--GnxrylVn2b-Dw.text: Wow! Bogo sushi rolls. Can't beat it. Had a excellent experience with my family here. You have to try the shaking beef!! Good selection of sake for reasonable price. Go on Tuesdays and it's half off bottles!!!! Last but not least service was spot on. Must give Akahana a try!

Q1Xwdv2Sje7PLVzP1k4m2g.text: We have always been pleased with our service and food from Akahana. The menu is a little overwhelming with so many delicious options, but the Pho and sushi are really delicious!! (however, beware that their jalapenos are HOT!) We always sit in the bar area, so I think its ideal for a casual, weekend late lunch or girls get together before going out. Not exactly my idea of a romantic date spot; however, I haven't been there during dinner rush so I could be very wrong.  I will be returning though! Thanks for great food and great service guys!

fMYPcccHRjirX_UxO0GNDg.text: Wish I could do 2 and a half stars.....Went here for Thursday bogo night (yes it is only specific rolls and of those there are no vegetarian options????  WTF???).  But what I had was on the low-end of 'fine'.  The salmon when it came out in one of the rolls was room-temperature.  Hmmm....I had never experienced that before.  Not super appealing.  The rest was 'just fine' especially for those prices.    I liked the 'green' chopsticks - instead of the throw-aways they had plastic ones that were heftier.  Great job on that guys!    The bar service was better than the table service.  Try not to come at peak hours on bogo night and I am sure the service would be better.    There have been many establishments in this location and this is by far the best one.  I hope you stick around Akahana!!!  :-D

vB31qDq0BbLJFtRBR0i4oA.text: Hey Akahana, lookit you, all sexy with your buy-one-get-one-free rolls on Tuesday and Thursday. Mmm. Yeah, you know what I like.  So, I didn't try the rolls. During this Lenten season, I gave up sugar, both simple and complex, so no rice for me. However, I did try a wide spread, which was delectable.  FOOD: Mmmmsashimi, you never let me down. Their sashimi platter was presented beautifully, with long strips of delicate fish, fashioned into rolls. Very fresh, no odor, and a lovely selection of your usual tuna, salmon, white fish, and mackrel. I also got the squid salad, which had just the right amount of ginger kick to it. The only disappointing part of my meal were the green mussels. I'd never seen this selection on a sushi menu before, so curious, I ordered them. They tasted just like regular mussels, but perhaps a bit more tough. Let-down. :( On the upside, they do make a fabulous dirty martini, and I hear good things about their $2 martini nights on Wednesdays.   SERVICE: Attentive and playful, though not without fault. Was brought the wrong thing twice (wrong martini, and the clams nigiri-style instead of sashimi), but both instances were fixed in no time at all. We did feel like we were being rushed out towards the end. We did spend a while talking after the meal, but there were plenty of seats available, and we were still tossing back a few drinks, so it shouldn't have been an issue.  ATMOSPHERE: Chique, club-like atmosphere, with bold colors, modern lighting, and a very nice back-lit bar. The sushi bar seems a little secluded from the rest of the restaurant, but overall, this place has a modern and sexy feel to it.   PRICE: Average pricing for all items, but great deals on the specials mentioned beforehand. Definitely worth checking out.  Overall: It's nice to know there's a  place where I stuff my face with decent sushi even when I'm broke. Thank you, Akahana.

vljPpGvJjC_FbAQHQNg87Q.text: Y'all we went back and tried the sushi a bit more extensively. I have to say that if you are looking for a good fresh sushi experience, you are in the right place.  Their maki come with 8 pieces so I highly recommend mixing in some of their under $5 2-piece nigiri selections (smelt or flying fish roe, what what!). They are fond of adding tempura and avacado to things which cut the menu down for me, but there were still plenty of selections and they were tasty as can be.  Oh, and I wanted to hug our server. She was just the cheeriest girl I ever did meet.

ie-SWapMqNia3z7pOvSOTw.text: I went to this restaurant last week.  I am very picky about my Asian food and this place did not win my praise.  My family ordered Bun. I had yellow chicken cari. (curry).  The sushi was BOGOF.  The curry could use more spice, not heat.  I like a lot of flavor when I cook.  I also like my chicken cooked more well done than I usually find at Asian restaurants.  The sushi was a little dry (i.e. the rice).  I was also disappointed that they wanted to charge me $1 for a bowl of jasmine rice to go with my left over curry.

h_Av2zvBOSG2NtzJvwP89w.text: This was the best sushi I have had in awhile in Charlotte. All rolls are always BOGO, and they offer a wide variety. The first time I went I got take-out and the second time I dined it. The service was good but we were one of the few groups in the restaurant. Haven't tried the other parts of their menu yet but will definitely be back for their sushi.

Z86D5Yk7JmY66nMsQ_Arhw.text: Great sushi. They give you a good portion and it's always buy one get one half off.  Cant beat that!

aMmEB9MHFmYYtJH0GDwaZA.text: Went here for dinner the other night.  I had the massaman curry which was tasty but not served hot enough (temperature-wise).  We had a lovely waitress who was well-versed on the menu and, in general, I thought the service was great.    My main beef was with the menu.  Every combination and permutation of asian food is on here.  And that's not so good. When a restaurant has a menu this large, I immediately think it is not living up to its potential because it is spreading itself too thin.  It makes more sense to do a few things extremely well then a million things kind-of ok.  In an effort to please every possible restaurant-goer, the restaurant loses it's identity and does itself a disservice.  Is this a Thai place?  Sushi?  Chinese?  I have no idea.  I hope this place resolves its identity crisis and pares down the menu because I would love to see a restaurant (other than Subway) on this little corner of the Plaza succeed.

hSe1BLLXzz3TdjuEvCPxbA.text: Really great rolls! With great variety and well made. Avg roll is $14 so with bogo special they have everyday spending about $14for two rolls. The other Sunday night though we were there about 2hrs with about 1.15 waiting on food. They were busy but need to be able to keep up with demand

hQh84ZrOxYKwbpZOHIYZew.text: Short and Sweet:  Customer Service is so-so. It could be better. But they're mostly busy when I go here. The sushi is awesome. The menu is huge. There is also plenty for non-sushi people. It's on the pricey side for being in Plaza-Midwood. It's a little more expensive than Jade on some rolls.  Basically: If you don't care too much about paying for good sushi and don't get your feelings hurt on customer service.

GVzoY4J0pT1rCNY-HcE71g.text: I was at an event nearby so I had the opportunity to stop by Akahana for dinner. It was overall a decent experience. The atmosphere is definitely on the louder side but we had 0 wait for three people on a busy Friday night so I was impressed with the efficiency of their staff.   Starting off with the appetizer, the Agedashi Tofu was really good and I was surprised by the large portion of the dish. Usually when I order Agedashi Tofu, there's a lot less so this was definitely a 5/5.   We ordered the Dragon Roll and Sunflower Roll with the buy one get one free offer and both rolls were excellent. I am a huge fan of eel rolls so both were really delicious especially the sunflower roll with mangoes! I am a sushi fanatic so I have pretty high standards when it comes to sushi and the rolls I had definitely exceeded my expectations.   We also ordered the Deluxe Fried Rice and Chicken Pad Thai. The fried rice was a 4/5 for me. The flavor was very good and the rice and ingredients tasted fresh. The Chicken Pad Thai was a 3/5 for me just because I've had better Pad Thai with better flavor for a cheaper price. It was still good but the dish could've had a stronger flavor.   Overall, I would definitely stop by for the sushi. There's a lot of variety on the menu and I would love to come back and try more of the rolls. The service was also excellent and our waiter was very friendly. 10/10 would stop by next time if I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Agedashi Tofu Appetizer
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Pad Thai
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dragon Roll and Sunflower Roll

shIKbHEginWfC7EzR0CCaQ.text: I haven't been back since years, and this time was a big disappointment!  Picking this place knowing that they're not busy around this time, hoping to get food fast for my 2 y/o who was very hungry (3:30pm) Came in and not one single worker was out. So we sat down ourselves; totally fine.  Later I see two girls came out & one finally approached us &  asked for our drinks & what we would want order. Asked her if I can get a few more mins since I want to make sure I was getting something that my daughter could eat . We waited for the LONGEST time for her to come back.I was watching them both in the back on the phones showing each other something , talking,  laughing . My naive self wants to believe they're probably trying to figure something out or some. A good 15 min went by and no one even looked this way. I finally waived them down for attention and another girl took my order then asked if I wanted the all food to come out at the same time so I told her  I told yes! Like i mentioned, it was not busy at all, but our food took a very long time to come out. (ordered shrimp tempura udon, couple of sushi rolls  & shiu Mai) finally  the food's out  , but she told me shiu Mai is  coming soon. I asked her for a small bowl and then she walked away. I looked  at my udon, and there was nothing else, but just the udons.  So I waited thinking she would come back w/ the bowl right away , to ask about  the shrimp that was supposed to be with my udons...but nope.. About  10 min of waiting , wondering where she went bc at this point my daughter's stomach was growling and I'm getting irritated. I got up to look around and no one was to be found . Went back to seat and finally I see a different guy (maybe the cook) came walking out and asked him if he can get someone to come help me.  About another 10 min, my shiu Mai & shrimp tempura that was supposed to be with my udon finally came out , and once again.. I still needed that bowl. Note this; there was also another guy who came 30 min after us , also had to sit him self down but he ended up  getting his food BEFORE my girl finally was able to bring everything out for us. I came to realize it was around the time for the 2 girls to clock out, which explains why they were just SLACKING on service. despite it all, the food was actually good (explains my two stars)

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp tempura udon

BgB0SCvWUIRY2_4GSPmR8A.text: My husband and I stopped here for dinner last Friday. We arrived around 8:45 and got seated right away. The decor is a little outdated and it's snugged in the corner of a little shopping center. We came here because we were interested in checking out the Buy one get one sushi rolls. All of their rolls are available for this offer. We got two speciality rolls and decided to split the pad Thai.   Everything came out super quick. I was impressed with the portion of the pad Thai and it was very tasty. For the sushi it's what you kinda expected. It was OK, but don't think I would go back just for sushi as there are so many other places around here that have amazing quality for roughly the same price.   On the plus side they offer drink specials every day - including the weekends!   My final take away- if you're a California, fried tempura kinda sushi eater this place is for you. If you like raw, melt in your mouth sushi - you'll want to pass or get something else on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pad Thai with chicken
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

uXnskKYUFC7dcZPPPxcH8g.text: This place isn't your typical strip mall sushi joint. The host, a kind funny gentlemen (maybe the owner?) accommodated 6 people without a reservation outside. The two for one sushi promotion is allllllll the reason to go, this includes raw sushi, and hey it's pretty yummy! The sushi was fresh, I wouldn't recommend the Green Eggs and Ham-achi roll, it was mushy and blah, despite it's cute name. The bagel roll, if you like deep fried was DELICIOUS. The only reason for the not great review was the so slow service, we kept getting refills on our drinks because it took so long for us to get our dishes, and to pay our check. I understand they were packed but it was a crazy long time. I also think they should install fans outside or even box fans because of the humid summer weather this would definitely increase the people count outside.

OMusD8NLMd2gvM3-XgPDAw.text: I've been meaning to check out this place, so I finally stopped in for lunch today...  I used to be a frequent diner here (way back when?) when this place used to be a Chinese restaurant, and I've always loved the patio dining area. Well, that area still seems about the same, but the restaurant has changed quite a bit as it went from Chinese to Japanese. Not sure if it's better or worse than before. Anyway, I entered the restaurant a little before noon, and it was fairly slow...only 6 tables full of guests.  I ordered the Chicken Lettuce Wraps, as well as 2 plates of Maki Rolls since they offered the "Buy One, Get One Free" Makimono Special. Each Maki plate (approx 8 slices of Maki Rolls) is about $15 each, so I guess you're getting about $8 per plate.  Chicken Lettuce Wraps were pretty good, though the Lettuce wasn't super-fresh. As for the Maki Rolls, I went with the suggested "Deep Sea Roll" and "Bagel Roll". Not super fancy or unique, but they were both good...and super plentiful! I actually counted, and there were closer to dozen rolls each! If I knew they were such hefty order of rolls, I probably would not have ordered the Chicken Lettuce Wraps. No matter, a definite Plus for their generosity!  Both the hostess and the waiter were friendly and courteous...and so major complaints on service.  Overall, it was a nice, laid back lunch experience. I can't say this was one of the best Japanese I've had in town, but I liked it enough to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. L to R: &#34;Bagel Roll&#34;, &#34;Deep Sea Roll&#34;
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Lettuce Wraps

7B4bJj4Qhrx9mBFtbirPPQ.text: I'm a little bit of a sushi snob. This place is so overrated. Probably the most overrated places I've been.   I'm still so surprised it was so busy last night. Like why? I feel that the rolls were so subpar. Both my friend and I thought the same thing. Our rolls and my bf's pepper steak and fried rice took a 1/2 hr to come out. I understand it's busy so I'm not knocking the place for that. It's their rolls!!  Customer service is awesome!!! Our server was too kind. It was too crowded for me to experience an ambiance.   I hadn't had sushi is months and I'm so sad to have had this experience. Reviews don't liiieee, why did I think I'd come in and think this would be a good idea? I think the crowd made me believe that there was hope.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shocktop

eyUE1Lte1Loac-y9kpqbCQ.text: The fact that all of their sushi is buy one, get one free all of the time here is amazing! I was so tempted to order more food, but my two sushi rolls and the delicious appetizers that my friends ordered for the table were plenty enough! One friend ordered the shrimp shumai and pork gyoza (both steamed, of course) and another friend ordered the spicy edamame... all of which was delicious!   The service we received was excellent and the sushi and sake were great as well. My one friend did not like one of her rolls though and I cant blame her because it was very odd. She ended up getting a crunchy roll which was literally just that. It was filled with crunchy topping and nothing else, then topped with spicy mayo and eel sauce (I think). Either way, it was the strangest sushi roll I had ever seen. I'm a sucker for Asian restaurants though so I would love to come back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

OAPXSod3v22j_Wh8bmw_uA.text: The service by our bartender was fantastic.  Would have never thought to order a Bloody Mary here but my friend did and it was surprisingly delicious!  When ordering the cucumber special roll be sure to say cucumber special, or you will end up with the cucumber roll hand wrapped in seaweed and not a cucumber and not as yummy.  I loved The Plaza Roll and it could have been spicier, the jalapeno on top is a nice touch. I gave four stars as the tuna sashimi was not very good and was but very thick.  You can't beat the buy one roll, get one free.  Highly recommend Akahana in Plaza Midwood.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. L to R: one piece of cucumber roll, The Plaza Roll, Cucumber Special Roll and last piece of Tuna sashimi above the ginger and wasabi
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cucumber Special Roll

z4-h-jDBUZQChXXTqGrbkA.text: Live uptown so Plaza Midwood is just a few minutes away and we hit the area often for dinner and drinks with friends. Over the years Akahana has become a favorite for not only their location but also for the great Asian fusion, BOGO sushi and friendly staff. Always busy but rarely a long wait. In addition to the sushi one of my favorites has to be the shaking beef. Ask for one of the tall tables near the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

RBOZ00q96INBSciL_q4OOQ.text: BOGO sushi rolls - I am sure this is how everyone starts their review, but it's True.  Akahana is home of BOGO sushi rolls anytime, any day.   We were searching for some sushi on Friday night and figured Akahana would be a better bet than the new Sushi Guru down the street, plus we had our dog. I am happy to report the patio is dog-friendly.   I was torn between a non-sushi dish and sushi, but after hearing about the BOGO deal it was a little hard to pass up. We ordered a spicy tuna, spicy salmon, Cherry Blossom and a Florida roll. WOW. This was a ton of sushi. Super happy I was sharing with someone. The sushi grade didn't feel like the best, and that we were eating the bottom of the barrel, but I don't think that would stop me from coming back.   They also had drink specials which looked to be almost every day, all day!   Sushi  Dog-friendly  Drink Specials

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

EBK2cRZ7zsAzm33Wx3FVyw.text: The sushi was very good and filling! I loved the buy one get one free deal because no one really gets full off of one sushi roll so that's a great deal. We went on a Saturday night and were seated fairly quick which was great. The customer service was good and the sushi was prepared very well. They have TONS of options for you to choose from so there's something for everyone! Whenever I am in Charlotte I will definitely be eating at this restaurant

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

-LPkMq0eUkv2Ran3DTF_jA.text: We really enjoyed Akahana- buy one get one sushi with no exclusions on the menu.  Our server was fantastic.  The sushi was average- not exceptional but very good.  We had 3 rolls that were on special and 3 from the regular menu. I would definitely recommend for a night out- do not let the exterior fool you (strip mall)- we were pleasantly surprised as soon as we walked in.

KrGM4vvvSf3z2-v3on_TEQ.text: BOGO sushi was the draw, but the friendly staff and drink specials will keep me coming back!   Rather than just a few options for BOGO sushi, there are two full pages to choose from! We definately took waaay too long to choose our sushi, but our server was very friendly and even recommended a few popular choices to help us. We went with the following rolls: gulf to bay, spiral ecstacy, orange blossom, and earthquake. The best one was the earthquake roll- deep fried and deicous The sushi is pretty good for the prices, not high grade but also not low grade sushi. I'm not a sushi snob, so I was very happy with the flavors and grade of sushi we received.   They have drink specials each day and on Mondays (when we went) there was 1/2 price bottles of wine.   Bathrooms were clean, parking was easy out front in a small lot, and it was quiet enough to enjoy our conversation. I will definately be back for more!

R4sfCaQ_WqMdyQMoqRGUkg.text: By far my favorite late-night sushi takeout restaurant! Fresh spring rolls and BOGO rolls are always a good choice!

aMPsI4OffspfODc5xCV2Cw.text: Didn't have a good experience. The patio was full and a lady was smoking. I asked the manager to say something to her and he said they allow smoking in patio seating, which is mostly enclosed. Really gross and dangerous since children were sitting out there. Later I saw that manager go hang out right off the patio area where his friends were congregating and smoking (non restaurant customers). Smoke was coming from both directions. Unfortunately the inside is always freezing.  They also keep going up on their prices so it's expensive if you only eat one roll and can't take advantage of the b1g1 deal. I do enjoy their sushi and their fried rice is some of the best in town.

9UOz1FA1wdSQ1PA9XCFx5w.text: What a great birthday lunch. I  truly enjoy this place. What fresh sushi and today I learned that they know how to make. Scooby snack shots that were amazing. Thank you Crystal for taking such good care of us. I truly recommend this place to everyone. It will surprise you how clean and nice the atmosphere is here.

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday dessert
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sushi time
Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch

Yfo6YPJrNulTANImdtBvmQ.text: Hard to argue with BOGO sushi.  Parking can be a pain sometimes as the strip mall isn't the easiest to navigate, but once you get past that, decent variety of rolls available as part of the BOGO (no substitutions please) and while the freshness, creativity and presentation of the sushi here will probably never be confused with some of the higher end places around town, in terms of value, it is hard to beat.

1ujJsXIby4PnuvvQeTVMrA.text: As I sit here at the bar for the 4th or 5th time, I decided to review: 1. Manager of owner is friendly and comes by to check on you. That's a plus. 2. Sushi is fresh and selection is just OK... Too many similar options on the BOGO. Cream cheeze and spicy mayo... Not real sushi to me however there are other good choices. 3. Ambiance is ok, decor and lighting is nice. 4. Every single staff/waiter/bartender I have dealt with has the personality of cardboard and the customer service skills of an ant. Not friendly, not even interested in your needs or if you're ready to order or leave. I just had a take out box handed to me as the bartender rushed by. She shoukd be putting the food in the box for me. That's too bad as I want to like this place but the staff suck. There goes her tip.  Order carry out and skip the hospitality... Or lack thereof.

Spig7LUzLhz6C6m6Vj60LA.text: Here is yet another time I wish for a half star because I am a bit torn between a 2 and 3 stars. So I dutifully read reviews from some of my favorite people on Yelp before heading over to this place so I thought I knew what I was getting into. BUT unfortunately I was still disappointed!  Let's start off with their bogo sushi "deal" $14 for two rolls is pretty standard for a basic sushi place but these rolls were the SKIMPIEST I have ever encountered. The fish on the outside of both my rolls was paper thin and the roll itself was about the circumference of a quarter. So for $14 I would have been better of going across the street for sushi at Harris Teeter.  My wife is not a sushi person so she got one of their rice dishes which came so over salted she could not even eat it:(  I will say what I assume was the owner or manager of the place was all over the restaurant checking in with guests which was nice to see. If he had asked me how my meal was thought I would have told him I was a pretty disappointed.   I really want this place to be better so I might keep an eye on it because I would love for it to be more like New Zealand Cafe:)

photos.caption: Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cherry and Lotus Blossom Rolls

EipgAHy5XK2gAe-JLLea3Q.text: One of the WORST dining experiences I've ever had. Came here with my husband, my sister, and two friends. We waited 30 mins to be seated, then ONE HOUR after ordering our food for it to come to the table. We never complained to the waitress (only because we didn't get a chance to- she never acknowledged that we had been waiting so long; never apologized that we still hadn't received our food). Then the manager came over to our table to tell us our food was on the way and apologized that we had to wait 40 mins. We were livid at that point, because it had actually been an HOUR, not 40 mins. Her response was "well, according to the ticket, your food had been entered 40 mins ago". Our response was, "yeah, probably because the waitress entered it 40 minutes ago, but we had actually ordered an hour ago". Her response was a snarky "your food will be here shortly". About a minute later, our food finally arrived. Mine and my friend's sushi were missing rice on some of the sushi rolls; it was as if they expediently and sloppily prepared them. My husband did not enjoy the two rolls he ordered. My sister's non-sushi dishes were barely palatable. Truly awful experience for all of us. We will not be back.

bz7pPSkx74iEpBHgjrJuMA.text: So Akahana what's up? Do you hate me that much that you always pair me up with the very inattentive waiter that messes up my order every time?  Leanne C.'s review pretty much sums up our experience there. I got told I could have cake, then the cake was a lie, then there was cake again. Quit playing with my heart! I would've ordered some food to go with the cake if you hadn't taken almost an hour to bring it out of the freezer. My love of dessert for dinner is unrivaled, but this was really crappy cake that I ended up giving away because I couldn't stomach it's frozen sickly sweetness. I suggest that you inform people next time you're serving them cold chocolate cake because I kind of envisioned a warm fluffy moist piece of chocolate yumminess.  Service was awful, bad, below mediocre, crap, pick any negative adjective you like. Sake was ordered at the start of the meal and came out near the end after we had said we didn't want it anymore since it was so late, at least our server realized how big of a mess that was and comped us for it.  I hate the stupid BOGO deal, just price your stuff reasonably because I don't want to always eat 2 rolls when I come here. I think I'll have to end my relationship with you here for a while Akahana.

awg0GvnFDIfZkzWuSpFDLA.text: We ordered take-out from Akahana last night and it was appalling. I rarely write reviews, but I was so upset that we paid nearly $60 for a terrible dinner that I had to warn others to not eat here. The ordering process was fine and the girls that work the front are very nice and helpful. However, the food itself is just horrible - NOT what I would expect for $13-$15 entrees. As one example, the flat noodle dish came with most of the flat noodles congealed together in what was supposed to be a "sweet brown sauce" that was actually a soupy, bitter tasting oily sauce that left a horrible aftertaste in your mouth. The sushi, which seems like a great deal because it's buy one get one, was meh at best. The rice paper wrapped appetizer roll was filled with lettuce and some noodles, completely tasteless and instead of the promised peanut sauce came with a clear fish sauce. (The sauce is a personal preference, but the roll itself was spectacularly underwhelming.)   I am so shocked that a place like this can exist, with all of the great restaurants we have now in Charlotte. I promise, I am not one to call out anyone - as any place can have a bad night. But I was so thoroughly unimpressed and so upset over spending so much money on something so bad, that I had to let everyone know.

3F3LQ1q70NihQeyqZBDGiQ.text: Came in to the restaurant and sat here for 20 minutes and had no service. Jason was supposed to be our waiter but he found every reason not to pass us, so we asked a very nice waitress out of the dining room to help us and she politely took our order even though she was busy and Jason was not.

R5O0WWhzFdbiiuMVmh-TvQ.text: This is a place we used to go often...and we stopped going ...but we gave it another chance after six months and the food was great....The new GM seems to have made the difference and great manager and bartender...give it a shot

O5YOjfVfo3IIReSvpMIjww.text: Got the pho and it was much better than I expected. Tons of flavor and would definitely get it again. The bogo sushi is always a winner but glad to have success with something new.

vluwuN-S9w-r2ZhAvIp26Q.text: First let me say that I used to absolutely love this restaurant. The rolls were awesome and so we're the dishes I've tried (curry, lo mein, soups, fried rice, tofu,etc). My liking for this place changed after I found the tail of a bug in my takeout food!!!! The manager said an exterminator came out and the only thing he can conclude is that the bugs came out to breathe bc they were suffocating from the fumes....wtf?!?! He only offered to buy me another meal as of I'd step foot in there again. I demanded they put the money back on my card which he said he'd look into but never did. Poor customer service and disgusting establishment.

2JHpghzM7POzfFyNw9R2Eg.text: *giant sigh of disappointment* So, in my last update, I mentioned that this was no place to write home about. Well you can now! If you feel like being negative...  So I ordered a veggie roll (8 pieces, $12. Are you kidding me?!) and my friend ordered some sort of salmon roll (8 pieces, $12 also...). Jimmy ordered chocolate cake.   And then we waited. And waited. And waited. And waited.... and 20-40 minutes later, we were finally served. Jimmy's cake was literally one of those generic three-layer-take-out-of-freezer-and-thaw cakes. Super sweet, cold and high in preservatives. Sushi places usually have some sort of mochi, ice cream or sweet rice- not here! My sushi was barely cut all the way through and not laid out too nicely. It was pretty disappointing.  The server I have had before and he was awful and not very attentive... I thought it was maybe because he was doing prep work at lunch. Thennn there was this time. He wasn't working any other tables once we ordered and the service was still awful. Miscommunication with the bar (my friends ordered sake and it came INCREDIBLY late), Jimmy's cake (they said they were out of cake after 20 minutes, then brought some out 10-20 minutes later), and of course a long time until we got our food.  Oh Akahana... tweak your staff, adjust your sushi prices (get rid of the buy one, get one free and just make them reasonably priced), lower the terrible music and get some decent desserts. Then we'll talk again.

6Kwv8JzHjUKtIKvd-b4yBw.text: Akahana had won my heart when I found out they advertised buy one get one free sushi everyday - but then I took it back.  In theory, the BOGO deal seemed amazing but after a visit, I realized it was a big disappointment and honestly, pretty misleading.  The sushi rolls are nearly double the price I pay at other locations.  $12 for a typical roll with tuna, avocado, cucumber and a special sauce and it's is mediocre in size?  Yeah, I better be getting a second one!  The service was good and I thoroughly enjoyed the $2 martini specials.  The curbside appeal was bleh since it's located in a strip mall.  However, the interior is nice but not spectacular.  I don't have a reason to return in the future but it wasn't my worst sushi experience either.

NemGpi8JWvImEJ8YCeYCLw.text: Come here quite often as its close to my neighborhood. If you are looking for a diamond in the rough this is not it. What it does provide is tasty and reasonably priced sushi in a hip atmosphere. Some of their daily specials include $1 sushi (which is actually decent quality) and BOGO or 1/2 off sushi rolls. Again if you are looking to just satisfy a craving this is a good place.

B-_JuIBuqDzQSxPxinoS3g.text: I've always had really good experiences here. Seriously, never had a bad meal. I almost always do the buy one get one sushi rolls. My favorite is the Charlotte and bagel roll. Spicy edamame is very delicious too!

Ml5a1_jwxu9kvk_qjMo0rA.text: Yeah BOGO great but had BETTER be BOGO with those small sushi rolls for that price!! Nice, cute, man-bun waiter.

9BQiBHHRoinns6EeCIusbg.text: We came here tonight with a group of 10 and hardly saw the waitress. It was her first night so we'll give her a break. One person didn't get his rolls until after everyone was finished, another order was wrong and corrected an hour after ordering. Checks took forever to get. All with no comments from the manager. Disappointed. Then the owner told his waitress it was HER mistake. It wasn't all her fault and don't throw your employee under the bus in front of a table full of people who have worked in food service. We will not be back.

JpD1GKMIyJ-vD56JlXy_xw.text: I've gone twice more to Akahana and either my taste for sushi has become a bit more snobbish or Akahana has gone a bit downhill.  Let's first start with the atmosphere, serious techno beats at 6:30pm on a Thursday is not relaxing. The lights were bright - and it's not really a club atmosphere so why the club music? I am not a big person by any means but I felt as though I was sitting in a little kids chair, I could not imagine if I were a bigger guy.   We started with the spring rolls which were downright gross in my opinion. The pork just had a really funny flavor and they were over-cooked. My boyfriend ate them, but he eats everything ...he even said so himself, so I doubt he really liked them either.  We split four rolls 1) Florida- good flavor, the avocado was fresh and perfect. The tuna is that mashed chopped-up kind and it was just be so much better if it was just a nice small piece of raw tuna.  I also felt like all the rolls were a bit warm.  2) Orange Blossom- Again with the chopped tuna, but at least they had a nice salmon piece. I liked this roll flavor-wise but again with the oddly warm temp.  3) Surf & Turf- It was ok, but I prefer cowfish Burgushi. The meat was just odd ( couldn't tell if it was lightly seared, raw etc.) Just not a huge fan  4) Spider Roll- Worst spider roll I've ever had. It was inedible for me- I had one slice and gave up. It honestly tasted like it had sand in it, even my boyfriend had trouble with this one.   So overall awful atmosphere + lackluster sushi means I probably will not be returning BOGO or not.

ImQHf3W8AtLHZJIUVG-rCg.text: Things I like: BOGO rolls (the fact that they offer it), the place looks nice on the inside, uhm...that's it.  Things I don't like: nasty stench of cleaning supplies/old fish/mildew, average sushi, sakitinis were very weak (even if they were on special, I expect them to not taste like flavored water).   I can't help but compare the BOGO deals to those in Raleigh. In Raleigh, almost every sushi place has BOGO all day long. If restaurants keep making their sushi cheaper and cheaper, that's fine by me - as long as it doesn't go down in quality. When I found out Akahana offered BOGO rolls, I thought I'd check it out. Wasn't the best but I couldn't get over the smell right when I walked in.   I can't even remember the rolls I got, I came here a month ago, but the rolls were so lackluster, I don't remember what they were.   Food is average - maybe even below average. Service was good. The girl was new, so she couldn't really suggest anything when I asked her what was good.

BRVBdYBRHkI7ybqeptp41w.text: Tried this place again for a friend's celebratory dinner. We had another server on her 'first day'. She seemed sincere and I believe her, but I've also gotten this excuse before.  Tonight one order didn't come out at all and one came out with an incorrect mix of rolls. The story was another server grabbed the plates, but it took another 30 minutes after acknowledging the mistake to be served our original order. Very disappointing!

xyEWAEtJJVdtwNx0Qm29oQ.text: Went with a group of friends craving sushi...we each ordered two rolls, since they are BOGO1/2.  I ordered the Surf and Turf roll and Spiral Ecstacy.  Both were delicious.  A friend got the Charlotte Roll, which while messy was tasty (much like a good crab salad on top).  Favorite of the table was the Furious Dragon--which had just enough of a kick to be spicy and good, but not tooooo hot.  16 pieces  I've had bad sushi before, and this was definitely not it.  Sushi tasted fresh, was tasty and artfully created.  Will be back.

AjbhpxSw7ezvVUnXm3bceg.text: I have to give this place a 5 star review I love their menu. It is large because it's a BOGO menu. I'm a regular here and I enjoy the sushi the most, it is perfectly priced and made to perfection, not as fresh as an onshore restaurant but great for inland. If you're in college and in the area and you live sushi this is a great spot !

RP8ngqbHghQ1jHf3nGbz_A.text: I have always thought the sushi here was mediocre.  Not only this, but BOGO is a rip off. How can they get away with charging $9 for a California roll is beyond me. Not only that, but they add gratuity based on the price of these free rolls. Go to Soul Gastrolounge across the street instead, or even the Harris Teeter would suffice.

eEnoPBwdnTIZT7nH_4cNcQ.text: It's taken me a while to finally get this review down...and I think it's because I really want to love Akahana but, overall, I just kinda like it. The interior is pretty slick, the menu a large Asian compilation, the staff was friendly and efficient but overall, the food was what held back this review from a 4 star. This ambivalence has delayed my review, but here we go.   BOGO sushi every night now. Yup. Every night. While this is pretty great (as our bill for four rolls and an appetizer was under $40) it's also a little worrisome. Did Akahana jack up the prices of all the sushi to accommodate this special? Or, instead, are they serving smaller or fish of a lesser quality? Well, while the portions were ample, the sushi tasted fine, but not great. Here's the run down.   Asian Summer Roll: 4/5: A fresh, nicely stuffed shrimp Vietnamese inspired spring roll with a thick dipping sauce. Go easy on the sauce.    Spicy Tuna: 3/5: The spicy tuna, while it tasted fine, was strangely very, very red. Like atomic red. Kudos for not slathering the tuna in mayonnaise, but the bright red color frightened me.  Crunchy Tuna Roll: 2/5: Too heavily fried for my tastes and again with the fire engine red tuna?   Cherry Blossom Roll: 4/5: Fresh, tasty and delicious. I would go back just for this roll.   Mt. Fuji Roll: 3/5: A little too sweet  - if I recall correctly it was topped with mango and a too much sweet sauce. Could be delightful if it was suaceless.   I may head back to Akahana for lunch or to pick up some sushi to go...it's definitely worth another try, if not just for BOGO!

FycApb-_U97ZhMbuUYa7RQ.text: The first time I visited this place I thought it was pretty good!!  Ended up getting spinach fried rice which was awesome!!  Went back for the second time and they had already changed the menu!!  They had taken off some things I had seen on the first one!  One of them being what I had orderd!!  Ended up getting chicken and vegetables in brown sauce.  Had about two tiny pieces of chicken!!!!  The rest was rice and veggies!  Very disappointing!  Tried it again and the red curry chicken was a little better.  If I'm gonna pay for chicken I want some chicken!!  The service is good though and so are the drinks!  That's the only thing I will go there for!

IoDPPsU8ibcDXpU4gbLAYA.text: Conveniently located on the corner of The Plaza and Central, Akahana is a nice little bistro with great potential.  There are plenty of things to like about Akahana, but definitely a few glitches to this place.  The Good:  1. The location: I can't think of any other sushi places in this area, and it's just a hop, skip and a jump away for anyone who lives near this neighborhood.  2. The decor:  It has a kind of trendy look, but some nice decor.  The bar area is very cool, all lit up.  The waterfall at the door looks great as well.  It's a little dark, but fairly cozy-looking.  3. A huge menu: Their menu is very large, with a great selection of appetizers, sushi rolls, noodle dishes (different Asian styles), salads and more.  4. $5 lunches: I am not sure what time lunch ends, but in addition to getting lunch-sized portions of food, you can also get $5 at certain times on weekdays.  They have sushi lunches, noodles, and a few others.  They have pretty decent portion sizes for $5 too.  5. The drink menu: They also have an extensive number of specialty drinks.    6. The spicy edamame:  Not too hot, but full of flavor (maybe a chili sauce mixed with teriyaki?).  The OK:  1. Buy One Get One Half Off:  All right, this is a pretty decent deal (it's every day all day), and they offer it on pretty much all of their sushi rolls.  The rolls range from like $5-18, depending on what you're getting.  Their specialty rolls start at around $9 and up.  They are pretty decent sized rolls too for the price.  2. The quality:  The fish quality is ok.  It's not as fresh as Yama or the Cowfish, but it's decent.  The sushi rice is pretty good, with just the right texture of stickiness and plenty of flavor (the right balance of savory/sweet, not too sweet or vinegary, with hints of sesame).  Some of the rolls are downright delicious, but some are just mediocre.  3. The drinks: The cucumber martini was very strong and not quite my style, but probably good for people who really love that brand of vodka.  I had one drink (I can't remember the name) that was pretty decent, but not very heavy on the booze.  I had their sangria once, and it was decent but watered down.  The Not-So-Good  1. The service:  I have had decent service once, but two other times it has not been great.  It was virtually dead in there every time I've gone (I've only been there at a late lunch time). In three trips, I have not once gotten my appetizer before the rest of the food, so the timing is a little weird.  Overall, A-OK is probably an accurate summary of my experiences here.

dbICzlnG1aMPpV_esIE6bQ.text: Friendly staff but food wait time was a bit lengthy. Dragon roll wasn't complete. Salmon dish with the coconut sauce was tasty.

ERTjSUtT63eC89Dqg3Sd_A.text: Akahana is an absolute must do for the Plaza Midwood neighborhood location. The food is fantastic, the environment is fun, and the staff is second to none. Ian and Dalton always go out of their way to make sure our experience is the best in town. Hands down best place in Charlotte!

nDDtHBbnIQlTxc4onAaavQ.text: Came for an early dinner date on Saturday night. Greeted and seated promptly. Buy 1 Get 1 Sushi Rolls all day every day! Wow! Both meals were fantastic and given amount of food and sake, very reasonably priced. Will def be back.

9IoPaFFOQAKHCAROzBinOg.text: $2 well drinks on Tuesdays and buy one get one free sushi rolls every day!  With those specials it is easy to eat there. Fair warning-I don't think it is the freshest food in town and last time I was there another patron had her phone stolen from her table when she visited the restroom.

_S29G4VsDRRjBpGwpM7m1w.text: I like Akahana.  My husband always takes advantage of the BOGO rolls and I always get a nigiri plate (which comes with soup and salad).  I've also had curry here before and enjoyed it.  My only issue is that the service sometimes isn't the greatest.

bZQOd3uanrXQ9NFjymj59Q.text: I have a love hate relationship with this place. The food is good but at times inconsistent. My favorite things to get here are the pineapple fried rice, Vietnamese steak, and sushi.  The sushi is such a bargain. Buy one get one free everyday. You can't beat that. The prices ate very, very reasonable. Fairly inexpensive for a solid meal.

xzOBJNhzmP6HY-a8QNypUA.text: This is a great go to takeout sushi place for the Plaza-Midwood neighborhood. My husband and I order from here at least twice a month. We would probably eat here at least once a week, if they would answer the phone!   We have decided to order takeout on at least three occasions but couldn't because their number would be busy or would ring and ring with no answer. I just tried to call them 7 times. Half of the time the line was busy and the other half it just rang nonstop.   Guess we're not getting any maki tonight. :(

pdRScLSpGoxNfFR04Ksxag.text: Went here on a Tuesday evening when my hunger was at its prime. I ordered some sushi. After a single piece I knew something was wrong. It was just not fresh especially the rice. I felt like throwing up so I stopped eating and drank the beer I had ordered instead. After a while I though I had second guessing myself and tried another piece. It was the same bad stale taste. I stopped eating. I think I had two pieces out of the 10 or so on the plate. I lost my appetite altogether. BUT, the  worst was when the waitress came by to hand us the check. She asked me if I needed a box for the remaining sushi. I actually said in an almost apologetic tone  "mm.. sorry I actually didn't like them at all. I couldn't eat them".  She looked at me without any expression and nodded and said "Okay" and went away.   The LEAST I expected was for her to ask me what was wrong with the sushi. I would have told her gladly. Anyway, I will not go there again because this restaurants sucks.   The Akahana at Baxter village is much better. A better crowd comes there and they are much nicer to you. I think it's a SC thing!  BOO AKAHANA. Two thumbs down.

uKGF538b48Q9BYL7YykcLg.text: this is our last visit to Akahana after years of visits. the one thing on the menu that I always get. ALWAYS was awful, had our waitress bothered to come back to our table I would have sent it back, but she didn't. Even after passing our table 3 times.  Had to ask the hostess for our check. will not be returning

c_nTf3K9Kl2H5ldUrABu-g.text: Today was my first visit to Akahana and I won't be back. There were about 9 tables (including people sitting at the bar)  total in the restaurant and only ONE server. She could hardly keep up. There were dirty tables and spots at the bar everywhere because tables weren't being cleaned quickly enough.   Other customers were looking around as I was almost seeming to wonder "Where is our food?!" Our edamame appetizer sat in the kitchen window for 5 minutes before being brought to us. I know this because I saw it sitting there.   Our 2 sushi rolls (not fried) took about 35 minutes to be prepared and served to us. I noticed there was only 1 sushi chef. I'm not sure if that's typical for a holiday day lunch shift but it probably shouldn't be. The younger gentleman sitting at a table behind us sent back his sushi roll because "the crab tasted funny". Not a good sign.... We almost walked out before getting our sushi rolls but felt bad so we stayed. The rolls were nothing to write home about. In hindsight, I wished we had gone somewhere else instead. We could have eaten almost anywhere nearby for a quicker, cheaper, tastier lunch.   They do offer Buy One Get One sushi rolls. Our check with 2 rolls and edamame and a soft drink was $24. It would have easily been at least $35 if we had paid full price. Thank God we didn't.

vP1jBWWmvKvb2gkVon79TA.text: Buy one roll, get one free. Then you don't even have to feel guilty about devouring two rolls in one sitting. The owner/manager makes some pretty comical dad jokes too!

YO2hzyMjMzwILn0xhN4-Fg.text: Yummy little Asian fusion joint in Plaza Midwood. We stopped in on a weekend afternoon around 1:30 and sat outside with our little chihuahua pup. (Extra points for the dog friendlyness!) I had the spicy basil dish with chicken and it was phenomenal, fresh and spicy with just enough sweet to balance. My grandma had the pineapple shrimp rice dish and it came served in half a fresh pineapple!!! So fun and delicious with hearty helping of shrimp. My mom got miso soup and two sushi rolls (buy one get one free!). All in all a cute place, good food and quick and friendly service! Will definitely be back.

HYHn3Zg8y92hUGvzQOa56Q.text: This is my most favorite sushi place in the city! The service is wonderful! The food is wonderful! The prices are wonderful! And they have BOGO free sushi rolls every day! I come here once or twice a week, and I always get the Ahi Hawaiian roll and the Bagel roll, but my boyfriend is a bit more adventurous so he has tried most of the sushi menu, and it's always delicious!  We usually sit at the bar, where Hannah waits on us and she is an amazing bartender! She always gives great service and is extremely friendly! But we were in there last week for my birthday and decided to sit at a patio table outside since we had our puppy with us. Candice was our server, and she is great as well! She was very very attentive and friendly! The staff and the food made it a wonderful experience as usual!

R3scIecJWB21XUKv31UUSw.text: 1) BOGO: what a gimmick.  Their rolls are about half a roll from most other restaurants, so you're paying $14 for 2 mediocre halves.  2) AVAILABILITY: Tried to order some a la carte nigiri and sashimi.  Pretty much everything I tried to order was unavailable and has been "for MONTHS" (per our server).  Uh... then maybe don't have it on your menu.  Then the waitress said the restaurant doesn't order it because they don't make money on it.  Uhhhh... then maybe raise the price? I think people who want uni or toro will understand that it will cost more.  3) VARIETY: Sure, variety is the spice of life, but I don't trust an Asian restaurant that serves multiple different Asian cuisines.  I only tried the sushi so maybe the pho, thai curries/noodles, udon, and teppanyaki is really good... but dubious.  4) SERVICE: Our server was adorable and nice, but she was not good at her job.  Her timing was so bad it was comical and it provided us with entertainment.  E.g., she would only come to take food/drink orders when one of us was in the bathroom.  Also, she never blinked.   TL; DR -- Wholly unimpressive; BOGO is a gimmick; service is bad.

MX3OEciEOnb--JgpawqS5Q.text: This is my favorite place to get sushi in Charlotte! Not only do they have creative rolls, but they are buy one get one FREE. They also have spicy edamame that is to die for. The staff is also wonderful. The manager is such a friendly man who truly cares that his customers have a great experience. Go get sushi here!

jF_Xs_lOcyxhkTnphFG5Fg.text: Not bad. But not great. Buy one get one free sushi would be the only reason I would go. Service is suspect too

S52jMW1t2kso1v-CN04MYg.text: Great location, clean restaurant, cozy seating. The menu is enormous, but everything I've had has been amazing!  Love the Vietnamese shaking beef!

G1YEalpkwKKM-QNS_UShTA.text: This is my favorite hidden spot in Charlotte to enjoy sushi. I am sure there are other restaurants and bistros but this is my personal favorite. They have awesome service everytime I visit. The sushi tastes great and they have a BOGO deal on rolls. Great for lunch or dinner! No complaints from me.

I8VzC9bc4oZC_kVkssvegg.text: Wtf is this! Ok I'm alllll for BOGO. However, my sushi was the size of a dime.... Not worth my money. Maybe I should have purchases fried rice! At least my server was cool.

dWfNj4GadhI2tgDhWqoJCw.text: Surprised by the generally good reviews here.   Did not receive drinks until after 10 minutes of being seated. Another 10 minutes pass and our server never came back. I assume a manager or the owner stopped by and took our order. 20 minutes later we get our food. The restaurant was less than a third occupied. I was ready to give a one star but the food was decent.  The main thing I see people talk about is the cost. BOGO is always great. The portions were small, ingredients were not fresh, and cost was a little high (BOGO not great if the rolls are overpriced).  Would not recommend.

GPIZOws0bnAD-ESA3Plk5A.text: The owner is so friendly and who doesn't love buy one and get one sushi! Never has a problem with serves. But tbh food in general is decent but not worth the price and for some reason no matter what dish I get it tastes sweet like they garnish they food with sugar on every dish. But everything else is wonderful! Love their sushi and appetizers.

uQboyOdek3jdj-hIMOeKRA.text: I work a few blocks away and I'm kinda obsessed with their Beef Fried Rice. I wish it came w/ veggies but I just add Broccoli. Fair price for the amount (I have some for lunch and the rest for dinner #BacheloretteLife lol).  The sushi is BOGO everyday for a reason. I'm no sushi connoisseur but I think it's pretty mediocre. The shrimp sauce is even worse. 3 words... Too. Much. Mayo.

aVNamNOzMv-jb-_GQilv2A.text: I don't know why this place has 3 stars. I love their bogo sushi (of course). My only complaint is sometimes it takes a while to get food depending how busy it is but I'd say it's because the sushi is great and it takes a while for the staff to make it. The wonton soup is also great.

vaJ7hSqOaN_CGeek9paWUw.text: Me and my friend go here often the sesame seed chicken is amazing the menu is large so I always try something new service isn't always the best but I still come here for the food

dWhJ34DxSxes-DOi1z9Hvg.text: Akahana has a very trendy interior. The lights are dimmed and there's a blue tone that circulates the restaurant. The only issue I have with this ambiance is when I come for lunch. The entire restaurant seems too dim compared to Mr. Sun shinning oh so brightly outside lol Of course you can always choose the outside seating, which is nice during a cool afternoon.  This is the typical fusion restaurant with a very extensive menu. They have Vietnamese, Thai and Sushi. I just don't expect a restaurant with a broad menu to have amazing "omg, I have to live here" food (which is my normal reaction to a restaurant I love :P), but Akahana is decent. It's a good place to go when you're indecisive or if you have a large crowd with different tastes.I've tried all three cuisines here and the Vietnamese dishes are my favorite.  Reviews for all three cuisines:  The Vietnamese dishes are very affordable. I believe all dishes are $10 and under. The pho is pretty good, but it varies. From experience, it is really good on Wednesdays lol I'm not really sure why. The Pork Chop Rice Platter is my go-to plate since it has never let me down! It comes with grilled pork chop, an egg, rice and vegetables. Very delicious and filling! I would also recommend the "Vietnamese Shaking Beef (Bo Luc Lac)" and "Seafood Crispy Egg Noodle (Mi Xao Don)" I think most people will be overwhelmed by the Seafood Crispy Egg Noodle. It is a stir fry over a bed of fried noodles. It is HUGE and looks like a bird's nest lol   The Thai dishes are also affordable, about $10 and under as well. I've only tried the Pad Thai and I wouldn't really recommend it. The flavor is decent, but the noodles are never done correctly. They fall apart with every bite.  SUSHI! The sushi rolls are generally more expensive than other places (prices comparable to Cowfish, but not as yummy). Though the sushi is BOGO so it's decent. My favorite is the Spiral Ecstasy Roll! It comes with three different types of fish and avocado! :D The Tropical Exotic Roll is interesting. It's a sushi dish but it comes in triangles. I didn't really care for it (the presentation or the taste), but my friend thought it was unique.  Overall: decent food, affordable prices, trendy atmosphere, but nothing out of this world amazing

7_y6KjmmuNhNa4-b5fzibg.text: I love Akahana. The sushi is really great quality and tasty especially with the great prices they offer. It's my go to place when I want sushi. It's one of those hidden gems in my opinion.

yZKI_CpVtAk3U-4_sV9AqA.text: I had the rainbow and dragon roll, along with their lightly fried calamari and salt & pepper chicken wings.  The calamari was great, lightly battered, with a sauce that is slightly sweet and tangy.  Salt and pepper wings were spot on as well, i think its double fried because the wings were larger than what i've seen.  Most importantly, the rolls were bigger than what i've seen at other places, and the prices were average.  The staff were friendly, mostly college students, between 20-30s, fluent in English.

piIMI7NrmMn8nEvaAsRt8g.text: First things first: BOGO on entire sushi menu ALL DAY EVERY DAY! If you need a sushi fix and don't feel like dropping over $30 for two rolls...welcome to heaven.   It's not the worst sushi you'll ever have but its not the best.   Atmosphere is a solid B but a few other upsides are that they have a parking lot, never a long wait, service is quick and fairly large sushi menu.

IYf244-3SfiSRqPNJVc6dA.text: Stopped by here for lunch, came especially for the BOGO sushi roll deal which is awesome btw!! Ordered one of their vegetarian roll. (it was the one with the tofu skin forgot the name oops!) Pretty good! My mom had the posideon roll & IT LOOKED SO BOMB! She said it was really good, better than the place we usually go to(Yama). Atmosphere was nice, service was supper slow though. They had like 2 workers but our waitress was nice. Overall I would come back since it's BOGO which is a super duper awesome deal, and deff plan on trying their other items on the menu!

goAJeKR0_hVtuM2YqkPxcQ.text: It was in a strip mall and that's how it tasted. The sushi was dry and the plate was greasy and it looked like it was a used dish. The wasabi rolls had chunks of wasabi, which is not how it was described. The spicy tuna wasn't shredded and it just looked like raw beef. The vermicelli bowl was fine. The stir fried veggies were fine, but much more expensive than the price advertised on the menu. The waitress took a long time because she was too busy talking to someone for a long time. The owner came by and asked how things were. We had to ask him for the check twice before he finally did it.   1 star; if I could give it 0 I would.

gpQgcZDWZnTS8qVmmz7Mmg.text: Fool me twice, shame on me! After a previous horrible experience with the service at Akahana, my wife and I swore off the restaurant.  We decided to give it another shot, and, unsurprisingly, were disappointed again.  Oversized for the amount of staff, our food came out twenty minutes apart... After waiting 50 MINUTES for the first entree.  All the while, waters were not filled, and servers were running around empty handed like headless chickens.  After all that, the sushi was underwhelming.  Never again.

ip0faurhQuE5FWRKqZJtDw.text: My "go-to" sushi spot!! Great for take-out and dining in! Staff is always friendly and I love their sushi roll selection. Highly recommend the Florida roll, Charlotte roll and Volcano roll. BOGO, all day, everyday!

xIX6z-lbet74IWTsBmvC_Q.text: Decent sushi but a little overpriced for the quality and quantity even after the BOGO roll deal. The place isn't the cleanest either. It was a nice place To try but I likely won't be back.

DYlxH_0wUz7ZlEJC0p7GTw.text: BOGO sushi everyday which is the best deal. They have a lot of different speciality rolls. Some of the rolls can be a little small but its the best bang for your buck when it comes to sushi in Charlotte.

O7_p9hEgSYVt7qAfhJlwMQ.text: The sushi is always BOGO which was awesome. We ordered sushi, it was okay. The service was great though! The owner came and checked on us 3 times which I've never seen before. He was very nice and funny!

DPTSyzlB1DDgh6cD7MQt9Q.text: The Florida Roll & Watermelon Roll were delicious!! Cant go wrong with BOGO speciality sushi!

VCrsjka6akWlv59dsDRoWg.text: Where Akahana isn't an incredible location based on locale, they definitely pack a punch with a sushi menu of note. Checked these guys out for lunch after a long awaited and needed visit.   The decor is actually pretty swanky. I really like the waterfall with the glass logo behind it. Pretty snazzy. Cool bar setup, too.   We ordered a ton of sashimi and a few basic rolls. Check out my photo from the sashimi/nigiri platter. Gorgeous presentation. Fresh, flavorful and service was very fast and direct from the chef over the counter.   My biggest dislikes are the prices and the TVs. Prices do seen a little steep, but for the amount of food we ordered, it was well worth it. Can't say the same if it weren't for the buy one, get one half off deal. Probably wouldn't go back if it weren't around. And the TVs. Just yuck. Jerry springer and other garbage channels on all of them and the sushi chefs were glued to it. Kind of funny, but really disappointing. Daytime TV + sushi = no thanks.   I can say I'd be back, but maybe for a change from the regular sushi go-tos. Cheers!

Photo of Akahana Asian Bistro - Charlotte, NC, United States

Z5NkfzH2OKjifM4iFDYIYQ.text: Naturally, the first thing I do when trying out a new place is check out the reviews on Yelp and when I checked it out for Akahana, many people mentioned how bad the service was. I wanted to be the one who proved them wrong, the one to show everyone that Akahana would be my new, wonderful go to spot with terrific service but I'm sad to report I'm not that person.   I don't know if it was because they are newer and are drawing in quite a crowd on Thursday nights and the servers are overwhelmed but the service was almost non existent. We practically had to flag down our waitress to give her our order, get refills, etc. and I contemplated throwing a chopstick at our server to get her attention but with my luck, that would've either a) turn into a lawsuit or b) get violently ill from sushi gone wrong.   On the flip side, $17 for two rolls, a salad and a beer is A-Ok in my book. The sushi? Holy wonderful, fresh, yummyness batman! I was surprised by how fresh it was and how much flavor it had packed in the rolls. Some mentioned that the rolls on BOGO nights (Tuesdays and Thursdays) were smaller but I felt they were appropriate sized pieces for what they are charging (I can't remember the names exactly but got the Furious Dragon and Sweet Romeo roll). The downside about BOGO nights is that there isn't any vegetarian options on the BOGO menu and it says no substitutions on the menu.   The vibe was good-very vibrant with orange walls, moderate volume music and packed. They have a moderate sized bar area complete with the regular stuff you would expect-ESPN, Japanese beers and specials galore.   I will be back to check out Akahana.....but only when I have nothing planned afterwards so I won't mind waiting so long for my sush.

hsBBcDTDdH1Itj4ew-KuoQ.text: I had high hopes for Akahana. The interior is very tastefully decorated and modern. They have one of those cool waterfall-walls just as you walk in. I wanted to be 6 years old again and stick my hand in.   The place was clean, and the service was also really good. Unfortunately the food left a lot to be desired. I'm stuck between a 2 and 3 star here, because the entree black bean veggie stir fry dish my companion got was actually decent. What knocked it back was the STALE seaweed.   Aside from the black bean veggie dish, we ordered agedashi tofu and vegetable tempura. They were out of buckwheat noodles, and I can't eat regular noodles or udon anymore, unfortunately. So I stuck to just some appetizers. The tempura was adequate, but it's really not something I'd order again. The vegetables were undercooked on the inside and I wasn't fond of the taste of the batter.    The agedashi tofu was not anything I'd ever seen or tasted, and I *love* agedashi tofu. If it's ever on a menu, I have to order it. What I got here was awful. The tofu tasted old and dry, there was a thick, poor-tasting (old oil?) batter. On top of all this were a few strips of really horribly stale seaweed. The manager(?) noticed we barely touched the dish and she tried to say that it was a "firm" tofu they used, so that's why it might have tasted differently. I don't usually play the race card, but she was telling my white companion this while I was in the restroom. When I got back, she just smiled and left. Firm tofu? I've eaten tofu my entire life, whether firm or soft or medium or dessert or silken or chunky homemade or whatever. Question: Why even offer a menu item if you don't make it even remotely right?   They get a plus for having brown rice, but a minus for not having buckwheat noodles; a plus for great decor and good service, but a huge minus for having items on their menu they can't cook properly and also for having poor quality ingredients (read: old).
